<color=black>•</color> Can puncture tires, dealing 50% of the maximum Resistência to the vehicle zombie and repelling them.
<color=black>•</color> Benefits from Spikesidian's Odyssey Modifiers.</color>

plants.name: Tycoon Torch
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Though still a small child, Tycoon Torch returned from abroad with a showman's flair. His "turn a stone into gold" trick had audiences roaring with delight. Backstage, as he stirred a mysterious drink, he smirked and whispered, "It's kind of magic, actually."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Turn all straight-shooting bullets into coin bullets!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Convert all ordinary straight-shooting bullets encountered into 2 Silver Coins and 1 Gold Coin.
<color=black>•</color> Gold Coins will move in a straight line. Silver Coins will split to the top and bottom rows initially then join the Gold Coins in the middle row after 0.8 Seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Silver Coins will deal 50% of the original bullet's Dano.
<color=black>•</color> Gold Coins will deal 100% of the original bullet's Dano.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. 1% Dano increase to Tycoon Torched bullets for every 1000 Coins you have
2. Tycoon Torch's projectiles now deal splash Dano</color>

plants.name: Thornminator
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thornminator is one of the top hairstylists in town, revolutionizing botanical fashion with every masterpiece she crafts. "Real style takes real work," she says, twirling a carving knife between her fingers. Hammers and chisels may not be traditional hairstyling tools, but for her, they're essential for "fixing" even the most stubborn strands.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires Doom-Hypno Ice Spikes. When planted, unleashes a barrage of Doom-Hypno Ice Spikes.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Doominator-shroom</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each frozen pea inflicts Frio and adds 20 Cryo points. Deals ×4 Dano to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Doominator-shroom. 
<color=black>•</color> Attacks pierce infinitely, prioritizes air units.
<color=black>•</color> Has a chance to hypnotize zombies and cause explosive Dano—same effect as Doominator-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> When planted, scatter-shoots at least 60 Doom-Hypno Ice Spikes, targeting both air and ground enemies.</color>

plants.name: Helios Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Sun God—lord of light and warmth, the eternal ruler of the heavens. Wherever he treads, darkness withers, and life flourishes under his radiant embrace. Suspended high above the firmament, his indomitable glow pierces the void, casting away despair and igniting hope in all who bask in his presence.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons a Mini Sun to attack zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360×5/2s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Solar-pult.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini Sun every 36s. The Mini Sun lasts for 15s and deals 60+(40×Amount of Helios Cabbages) Dano to all zombies every 0.5s.
<color=black>•</color> When Sun exceeds 15k, consumes 200 Sun to inflict triple the Dano each time the Mini Sun Danos zombies.
<color=black>•</color> When the Mini Sun is present, the drop rate of Sun in the level is greatly increased, the Dano of ordinary meteors is buffed by 20, and an additional 250 Sun is dropped when they land.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 1000 Coins; if there is no Mini Sun on the field, summon it immediately. Otherwise, extend the duration of the Mini Sun by 15 seconds. Only one Mini Sun can exist at a time.</color>
<color=black>Related Odyssey Modifier: Magnetar Synergy</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You need to have unlocked all the Odyssey Modifiers of Magnetar and Helios Cabbage to obtain this synergy.
<color=black>•</color> When there are at least 10 Magnetars and 10 Helios Cabbages on the field, the Magnetar will summon the Helios Meteor instead, while Helios' summoned Mini Sun will not disappear and will also continue to summon ordinary Meteors.
<color=black>•</color> Helios Meteor: Deals Dano equal to (1800+1800×Amount of Magnetars) x (1+0.2×Amount of Helios Cabbages), and drops 1250 Sun.</color>

<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. When Sun exceeds 15k, each attack consumes 0.5% of the excess to boost projectile Dano by 20 per 1 Sun spent.
2. Summoned Mini Sun will deal ×3 more Dano</color>

plants.name: Mechanized Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After a full-scale mechanical overhaul, Mechanized Abóbora was a fortress on wheels. Composite armor? Check. Iron reinforcements? Double check. Tactical interface? You bet. Everything was perfect... until he caught a glimpse of his reflection. A crab. They turned him into a crab. "Guys, seriously?! A little heads-up would've been nice!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Abóbora with many functions.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color>
<color=#8B0000>Metal Plant. Has a multitude of traits.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Jack-in-the-Box explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Allows Digger Zombies to come out of the ground early.
<color=black>•</color> Halves Dano from Cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Allows you to use Iron objects to regain Resistência.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers: </color><color=#8B0000>To Be Determined</color>

plants.name: Radiant Pot
plants.introduce: Deep in the garden, where the sun always shines, Radiant Pot stands in quiet devotion. He doesn't chatter, nor does he boast—he simply gives, weaving sunlight into golden coins, waiting patiently for you to grow as radiant as he is.
plants.info:
<size=36>Can quickly generate a lot of Sun and Coins.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits traits from Golden Pot. Produces 50 Sun and 100 Coins every n=(Current Sun/1000) Seconds, where 3 ≥ n ≥ 15.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Upgrade costs from Silver Pots to Golden Pots will not exceed 8000
2. Coins exceeding the maximum amount will be converted into Sun at a rate of 2:1</color>

plants.name: Pharos Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once the beloved director of the Plant Orphanage, she was more than just a caretaker—she was family. Her broad leaves were the perfect playground for young sprouts, offering shade, comfort, and joy. Though those days have passed, her kindness remains. "Oh? Would you like to try this marshmallow, my boy?" she asks, her warmth as enduring as ever.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots lasers to attack zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360</color>
<color=black>Energy Limit: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Search Alcance: </color><color=#8B0000>(2×Lumos Level+1) Rows</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> It has all the traits of Lumos Umbrella.
<color=black>•</color> Fires lasers to attack zombies, dealing 100% Dano every second. Prioritizes air zombies, and deals ×3 Dano to air targets. Can attack up to 4 zombies at a time.
<color=black>•</color> Every 2s, consumes up to 10% max energy to heal up to 2 injured plants in a 3×3 area for 5% max HP (max 500). Healing increases by 100% per Lumos Level beyond 1.
<color=black>•</color> When two Pharos Umbrellas are positioned one above and one below, they will link together, and their detection Alcance will expand to cover the entire screen. In this state, the two Pharos Umbrellas can simultaneously attack up to 6 zombies, and their Dano is doubled. Additionally, if exactly 6 zombies are being attacked, a 3×3 explosion will occur at the location of a random zombie every 6s, dealing 360% of the attack power as Dano.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Energy Limit ×10 | Recovery Speed ×20 | Healing Speed ×2
2. Normal Attack Multiplier → 360% | Explosion Multiplier → 1000% | Attack Interval → 2s</color>

plants.name: Avarice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"They told her not to open it. Naturally, she opened it."Avarice-shroom ran a finger along the ornate lid, gilded and humming faintly with temptation. Whispers spilled from within—hunger, envy, ambition—all begging to be set free. With a smile too knowing to be innocent, she lifted the seal. What emerged wasn't hope. It was profit. "Welcome, little monster," she whispered, as the abyss stirred and a new fortune clawed its way out.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>She can summon Mini-boss zombies!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Calamity-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Calamity-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini-boss Zombie depending on the scene:
Day: Professor Cherryz | Night: Giga Football Striker | Pool: Jackson Worldwide | Fog: Skystrider Mecha | Roof 1: Pozeidon | Roof 2: Clown Jill-in-the-Box | Roof 3: Ultra Mecha-nut
<color=black>•</color> At the same time, summons its ordinary Odyssey variant on all rows.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating the Mini-boss Zombie gives you a ton of Sun, Coins, and points.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating an ordinary Odyssey variant gives you 1 Plant Giftbox.
<color=black>•</color> It can only be summoned once per round. This plant will not spawn from a Plant Giftbox.</color>

plants.name: Cherrybomber Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Originally developed as a rapid-fire prototype for the Gatling Cherrybomber, Cherrybomber Drone was recently upgraded to fire real cherry rounds to combat the zombie surge—earning explosive acclaim.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides enhanced firepower when coordinated with shooter plants directly below.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Gatling Cherrybomber</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant and Subspecies of Gatling Cherrybomber.
<color=black>•</color> If there is a straight-shooting plant directly below, its attack CD synchronizes with that plant’s (up to 2 seconds).
<color=black>•</color> Maximum number of Cherrybomber Drones on the lawn: (number of lanes×2)</color>

plants.name: Napalm-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Napalm-Shroom isn’t just fire on the battlefield—his BBQ skills are legendary. His dream? To host the greatest barbecue party ever, with every plant and zombie in town invited.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs Napalm melons that split on impact and leave behind an inferno.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>3600</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360/7.5 Seconds + 36/0.02 Seconds (Inferno)</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Each melon creates an inferno zone that lasts for 2.5 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Alcance: 4 tiles; Manual launch: full board. After launching a Napalm melon, rests for 1.5 seconds, then charges up for at least 6 seconds, increasing Dano to 1+(charge time in seconds×50%) to a max of 36s.
<color=black>•</color> Attacks pierce all armor and split into 2 additional Napalm melons that target nearby zombies with the same Dano.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Charging speed and max charging duration ×3
2. Inferno zone duration ×2</color>

plants.name: Krakerbillion
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Taste the fury o' the briny deep, ye scurvy dogs!" Since sailin' back from Davy Jones' Locker, Krakerbillion be a changed beast—fiercer, greedier, and twice as hearted. With treasure plundered from the seven seas and a fire in his vines, he rules the water lanes like a true sea devil. Any zombie tryin' to sneak in from the waves best be ready to walk the plank… 'cause this matey fights with both hearts and no mercy!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Greedy overlord of the seven seas, capable of squeezing every last drop of value from zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5s + Insta-kill (Drown) × ∞</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Retains all traits of Krakerberus, but can drag zombies underwater an infinite amout of times (up to once per second).
<color=black>•</color> Zombies hit by its projectiles turn golden—when they die, they grant ×3 Odyssey points. Max bonus: +2000 points per wave.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Plants deal 5% more attack Dano for every 1000 points owned (up to +360%)
2. The Odyssey shop now has a 36% discount on Modifiers</color>

plants.name: Buck-shroom Squad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Buck-shrooms' worst fear finally came true—they really did get stuck to a Magneto-gumelo, and no one's been able to pull them off. But maybe it’s a blessing in disguise. With all the materials the Magneto-gumelo collected, they've upgraded their gear and become a true "Steel Battalion."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A multi-purpose squad skilled in rapid fire, anti-air, and sniping!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>6000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80×4/1 Second (Machine gun); 240/2 Seconds (Flak cannon); 400/3 Seconds (Sniper)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. 
<color=black>•</color> Machine gun rounds knock back targets and deal additional Dano based on the current HP of their Type 2 armor.
<color=black>•</color> The flak cannon targets only air units in its lane, dealing knockback and same-tile splash Dano.
<color=black>•</color> The sniper attack shares the same traits as Sniper Pea.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Sniper Dano increased to 1,000,000, with a 1/3 chance to trigger rapid-fire snipes, but attack interval increased to 7.5 Seconds
2. Knockback distance and flak cannon splash Dano ×3</color>

plants.name: Quantum McCornics
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He was born at the dawn of the universe, his age beyond reckoning. From the primordial void, he plucked three stars to orbit him as moons—treasures not even black holes could steal. Now, the old one finds joy in toying with this cosmic keepsake, as ancient as he is.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hurls ultra-dense black holes that collapses into an explosion, releasing all the absorbed energy.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360/2 Seconds (Mini Butter)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant.
<color=black>•</color> 75% chance to launch Mini Butter, shrinking non-miniboss zombies' size and HP to 70%. If shrinking fails, the target is stunned for 1.5s. Instantly kills imp-class zombies.
<color=black>•</color> 25% chance to launch an Ultimate Black Hole that lasts 2s, slows nearby zombies, and absorbs Quantum McCornics' projectiles in a 3×3 area.
<color=black>•</color> Each bullet absorbed adds 2s to its duration, up to 7.5s. When it vanishes, it triggers a large explosion (Cherry Bomb-sized) that deals 360 + 60% of stored Dano. If it lasted over 5s, the explosion radius significantly increases.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Ultimate Black Hole can absorb all projectiles
2. Ultimate Black Hole's absorption radius ×2</color>
plants.cost:
<size=36>
Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000> Chrono Kernel > Popcorn-pult x3</color>

plants.name: Tesla Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Tesla Magnet commands iron with thunder and thunder with magnetic fields. He grants his people eternal magnetism and built a kingdom of electricity. Yet beyond his military conquests and political achievements, he still suffers headaches in the search for a queen with the opposite charge.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Extremely magnetic, quickly absorbs metal objects and turn them into explosive cherries.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Lumos Magnet, metal object absorption CD: 0.5s.
<color=black>•</color> Can pull the pogo sticks from Pogo King Jack-in-the-Boxes and convert them into Jack-in-the-Boxes; also pulls (insta-kills) Kirov Drones and converts them into Jack-in-the-Boxes.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 360 Dano every 0.5s to 1 Giga-Trident Zombie or Giga Football-nut Zombie within Alcance.
<color=black>•</color> Launches absorbed metal after 3s, dealing the same Dano and AoE as explosive cherries; with full-map targeting and anti-air capability.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack Alcance ×2
2. Absorbs 3 Metal Objects at once, Dano to Giga-Trident Zombies or Giga Football-nut Zombies ×3</color>

plants.name: Astro-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Astro-nut journeys through countless parallel worlds of the multiverse and has seen numerous wonders — from a Sphinx that plays eerie music in forgotten deserts, to a skybound ruin where a three-headed idol once stirred; from the glowing meteorites near the Tiberium shores to armored strongholds stamped with Z-Tech. It wanders through dreams, just beyond the grasp of memory. The past fades — but here, he's quite ready for another adventure.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cosmic Wall-nut with time rewinding and extraordinary invulnerability abilities.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Quantum McCornics</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Quantum McCornics, anti-crush and takes no more than 1000 Dano per hit.
<color=black>•</color> Rewinds to HP from 3 seconds ago after taking 4000 Dano and becomes invulnerable for 2 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> 33% chance to ignore incoming Dano. Has a chance to teleport biters to the rightmost tile in its lane (10s cooldown).
<color=black>•</color> If HP falls below Resistência, restores HP equal to 1× Resistência after 36 consecutive seconds without taking Dano.</color>

plants.name: Titan Apeacalypse Railgun
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He left behind the ceaseless minigun for a railgun that fires with precise, silent power—channeling electromagnetic force sharp enough to remind some of Academy City's famed Railgun and a certain relentless shooter cloaked in black.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes HP to fire pulse rays with infinite penetration.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Titan Apeacalypse Minigun</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360×5/3s</color>
<color=black>Search Alcance: </color><color=#8B0000>±10° Horizontal Sector</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Titan Apeacalypse Minigun, attacks pierce infinitely and can target air.
<color=black>•</color> If Resistência is greater than 500, each attack consumes 100 Resistência.
<color=black>•</color> Attack power scales linearly as Resistência drops, up to a max of 900.</color>

plants.name: Boreal Lifereaver
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>At the heart of the tundra stands the Boreal Lifereaver, guardian of the frozen wilds. For years, it has endured unyielding winters, its branches heavy with frost, crowned with delicate lotus blooms. Even when playful newcomers etch runes across its bark, it remains steadfast and unshaken.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold gathers on spruce leaves, and lotuses bloom in the trees.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>60/0.02 Seconds (lasts 5 Seconds)</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom/blizzard respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Fires a boreal reaper saw every 1.5s that turns into a homing shot on hit, with each instance of attack applying Deep Frio, adding 1 Cryo Point, and granting 1 ice charge.
<color=black>•</color> When ice charge exceeds 50, it depletes to 0 every 5s to heal all plants in a 3×3 area for (ice charge ÷ number of plants)×(0.3×shield + 0.7×HP).
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Boreal reaper saws now last for 15 Seconds
2. Healing is no longer split among plants</color>

plants.name: Infernostar
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Infernostar may burn brighter than any flame, but it was futuristic cuisine that truly lit up the competition. At the Culinary Clash's grand finale, he shared his trophy with Astro-nut, whose time-travel snacks left the judges starstruck. Even the judge McCornics called it "out of this world."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Lareiras blazing with Carambola flames, boasting extreme ignition power and granting stars projectiles homing ability.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Infernal Esmagawood</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Infernal Esmagawood.
<color=black>•</color> No longer spawns Spicy Esmagaes. Every 51 projectiles affected spawns a Spicy Carambola in front.
<color=black>•</color> Ignites star projectiles (except spicy stars) for ×2 Dano, but with original traits removed (except magnetar stars), granting global homing with anti-air priority.
<color=black>•</color> Explosive cherries become Explod-o-Stars: ×2 Dano, global homing with anti-air priority.
<color=black>•</color> Affects other projectiles like Infernal Esmagawood. Triggers Jalapeño effect on death.</color>

plants.name: Atomheart Planterna
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The price of nuclear war isn't something just anyone can bear." A survivor of annihilation, Atomheart Planterna now chooses to restrain her core reactor, channeling its power into a glow as bright as the moon—guiding wanderers through the dark. But if anyone threatens the peace she holds dear… she won't hesitate to become the reaper of the battlefield once more.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Planterna sealed with radioactive frost, releasing cold fusions that strengthens with Lumos.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Oblivion-shroom</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>600/3s</color>
<color=black>Alcance: </color><color=#8B0000>3×5, can target air</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Attacks apply Frio and adds 36 Cryo Points.
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Dano increases by 100% × Lumos Level.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Oblivion-shroom. Switching form does not trigger on-death effects.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits of Planterna.
<color=black>•</color> Refracts passing Titan Apeacalypse Railgun beams into 3 beams with equal Dano.
<color=black>•</color> On death, triggers Ice-shroom effect and grants 10 Lumos level to all plants for 10s.</color>

plants.name: Radiant Pad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Her devotion to the Sun God flows louder than a raging river. Radiant Pad was eventually dismissed from the Sun Guard for being way too noisy—but that hasn’t stopped her from preaching His glory to every creature beneath the waves. So deep in her zeal, she hasn’t noticed one thing: she’s been blocking all the sunlight from reaching the lakebed.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Golden Lilypad that can quickly produce copious amounts of Sun and Fortune.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection with Radiant Pot</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Produces 50 Sun and 100 Coins every n=(Current Sun/1000) Seconds, where 3 ≥ n ≥ 15.</color>

plants.name: Titan Tyrannoflora Lux
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Titan Tyrannoflora Lux wasn't sure how he ended up on land after a deep-sea haul, but he's made himself right at home. "Why go back to the sparse, dark depths when zombies are always on the menu?" he growls. Legend says his appetite is so huge, the gourmet contests could no longer afford their electric bill—guess he's their new emergency power source.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A giant chomper attracting zombies with light—a master of luring, devouring, and digesting.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>5 + (Sum Resistência of Zombies)^0.33s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Each Lumos level reduces digest time by 10s to a minimum of 5s.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Anti-crush.
<color=black>•</color> Can swallow all non-miniboss zombies in a 1.5 tile Alcance.
<color=black>•</color> Using a Chomper seedpacket on it reduces digest time by 10s.
<color=black>•</color> Upon successful digestion, pulls nearby zombies from adjacent lanes to its lane and heals HP equal to 1×Resistência.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack Alcance ×2
2. Provides 2 Lumos level to a 5×5 area during digestion</color>

plants.name: Pea Girassól
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Actually, the Girassól behind me is my sister," Peashooter explained to everyone. "We've been inseparable since birth. She loves producing Sun, and I destroy zombies on her behalf." But everyone knows the truth: the cheerful Pea brother is a total siscon. After all, every zombie that gets near his sister mysteriously ends up vaporized by sunlight.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea Girassól can fire Sun Bullets which produce Sun.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>36/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Bullets has a 36% chance to drop 5 Sun when hitting zombies.</size>

plants.name: Cherryshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You think I have red-hot anger issues? Me? Bah! You're red and hot! Your whole family is red!" Cherryshooter despised being teased about the color of his head. But the jokes didn't last long. It was just a happy incident. After eating Especial cherries, Peashooter found himself turning red and hot, and surprisingly, he could shoot cherries.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherryshooter fires powerful cherries.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Bomb
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"So… it's obvious… we are Pretty Cure, aren't we?" The two Girassól sisters tried to suppress their excitement. "The world needs us to save it!" Their passion bubbled over as they shouted together, "Flash!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Bomb can produce Sun after killing zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 25 Sun for each zombie killed in the explosion.</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I heard some zombies grumbling about their inability to eat cherries. Well, here I am!" The cheerful Cherry-nut shook the leaves atop his head, boasting about his pure cherry flavor. "But first, you have to promise me something: when you have cherries, share a bit with me. In fact, just give me everything you've got! I was born for this!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherry-nut can absorb explosion Dano and restore Resistência.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Absorbs Cherry explosion Dano to restore Resistência. (From Explosive Cherry: 200, From Cherry Bomb: 1000)</color></size>

plants.name: Pea-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"No... don't call me ugly, or else... wait... I'll spray you." Pea-nut has always struggled with his "unique" appearance. But he firmly believes that what's inside a plant matters more than how it looks. Seeking guidance, he humbly asked senior Bowling Nut for advice and eventually mastered the technique of rolling nuts like bowling balls.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea-nut fires mini-nuts that can penetrate zombies.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds (Piercing) </color>

plants.name: Explod-o-shooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Meet Explod-o-shooter, the ultimate plant killer. He's more irritable than ever—who would've thought the warm and friendly Cherryshooter would swallowanother Especial cherry? Don't push your luck with him. That cherry stuck in his throat might just be his next shot—his face is already turning red!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots out cherries that explode on impact.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Its bullets will deal area explosion Dano.
<color=black>•</color> Has immunity to cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Reduces the Recarga of the last Cherry Bomb seed packet used for its fusion by 85%.</color></size>

plants.name: Solar-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Solar-nut always sees himself as an angel, blissfully unaware that the other plants often talk behind his back. "You know, if he adds a few black lines, he'd look exactly like a bee!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar-nut produces Sun while protecting your plants.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Dano Phases: </color><color=#8B0000>1333/2666</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 25 Sun on Dano phase transitions. Drops 50 Sun on death.</color>

plants.name: Pea Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pea Mine may not have eyes, but he has his own Especial way of sensing zombies. "I feel it…" he murmured, "The zombies are getting closer… closer… closer…" Pea Mine's heartbeat quickened, and so did his firing speed. Faster, faster… until, with a "bang," Pea Mine exploded into a burst of potato-flavored fireworks.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea Mine can attack before unearthing.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>36/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> Fusion returns 50 Sun.
<color=black>•</color> Attacks faster as zombies get closer, with a minimum attack interval of 0.5 seconds. Upon exploding, deals 1800 Dano to zombies in a small radius and releases 36 projectiles in all directions..</color></size>

plants.name: Cherrypeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherrypeater lives by the motto "good things come in pairs." Whether it's fighting zombies or handing out presents, he does it all in twos. "But come on," Repeater teased, "those cherries of yours aren't even close to ripe."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherrypeater can fire two cherries at a time.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Stop at red lights, slow down at yellow lights, and obey traffic rules!" Solar Mine frequently warns zombies. But to the zombies, all they see is the disgusting green hue before them. He clutches his green leaves and pouts, wishing for more sunshine. "After all, sunshine is what fuels us all!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Mine produces Sun until and after its explosion.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> Fusion returns 25 Sun.
<color=black>•</color> Drops 50 Sun on explosion</color></size>

plants.name: Mine-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once seen as small and weak, Mine-nut now stood tall and strong, boasting a pair of big eyes and firm flesh. Yet beneath that sturdy exterior, he felt fragile and feared shrinking back to his former size. The zombies quipped, "If you take another bite, you'll explode!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mine-nut can explode while being eaten and once when broken.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Dano Phases: </color><color=#8B0000>1333/2666</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>500/Phase Transition, 1800/Death</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Causes single-tiled explosions on Dano phase transitions.</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-shooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chomper has always envied Chomp-shooter's ability to spit out zombie remains, and he's tried to learn the trick more than once. Little did he know, though, that the secret wasn't a Especial skill—it was just that Chomp-shooter's mouth was slightly deformed, causing bits of zombie to leak out while chewing.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chomp-shooter can fire parts after biting.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour); 80/3s (Zombie part)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Spits out rolling zombie parts while chewing that deal 80 Dano each and have infinite pierce.</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As a young plant, Chomp-nut was notoriously picky about food, never swallowing zombies in one bite, which frustrated its parents. After much persuasion, Chomp-nut finally learned to consume zombies whole, just like its predecessors. "I'm not picky! I just want to imitate how zombies eat. I should try something new, right? It's definitely not because I don't have a neck!" Chomp-nut said while chewing on a zombie.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chomp-nut can restore Resistência after eating zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Restores 1000 Resistência after digestion.</color></size>

plants.name: Chompzilla
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chompzilla savors every meal, despite his smaller mouth. "Chompers are sloppy and don't hit the gym; they fall apart on the front line," he scoffs. "I only eat the essence of zombie meat and spit out the rest," he grins, though his backyard is filling up with leftovers.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Both a bulwark and fierce attacker.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000> 200/1.75 (Chomp); 80/3s (Zombie part)</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Chomping zombies restores 200 Resistência and deals 200 Dano. Spits out rolling zombie parts after that deal 80 Dano and pierce infinitely.
<color=black>•</color> Instantly kills unarmored zombies with less than 500 Resistência, restoring 400 Resistência. Also spits out parts that knockback zombies. 
<color=black>•</color> Every 40s, devour a zombie and restores to max (up to 16k HP). Excess Resistência drains at 200 per second.
<color=black>•</color> Dano taken per hit is capped at 1/3 Resistência.</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone was curious about how Solar Chomper transformed the zombies it devoured into sunlight, but it always hesitated to share its secret. One day, Girassól discovered that her Plant Food content had significantly diminished, revealing the truth: it wasn't actually turning zombies into sunlight.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Chomper can produce Sun after swallowing zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 100 Sun after swallowing a zombie.</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Delicious and enticing, Potato Mines taste just like self-heating mashed potatoes, earning rave reviews from zombies. Among them, fries take the top spot in popularity. As zombies flock to the tantalizing aroma of French fries, they have no idea they're also indulging in tasty potato chips. "Just wait and see," Chomp-mine said with a mouthful, "Their nutrients will soon become new mines."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>After swallowing a zombie, the Chomp-mine will grow Potato Mines in front.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>20s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> Fusion returns 75 Sun.
<color=black>•</color> Plants a Potato Mine in front of it upon swallowing a zombie.</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ever since her drink with Cherry Bomb, Chomper has been constantly "buzzing." She turned into an absolute menace every meal. The sound of chewing transformed into explosive pops as plates and bowls flew everywhere, leaving everyone unwilling to dine with her. After a show of hands, Cherry Chomper ended up eating in the yard… at least she no longer has to buy new tableware.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces a cherry explosion upon eating a zombie.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour) + 1800 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Creates a 3×3 Cherry explosion in the tile directly ahead on successful biting.</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Gatling Cherry's barrel was always red hot. He assured everyone that it was preheated to ensure faster firing. Everyone bought the story—until they caught him eating Especial cherries without even removing the barrel.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherryshooter's final form!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×4/1.5s</color></size>

plants.name: Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Don't let my size fool you; even a small body can contain a lot of energy," Pea-shroom cautions those who underestimate him. "We all began as tiny mushrooms, making progress a little at a time. With dedication to a sunny breakfast, you can become just like me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea-shroom shoots further than Puff-shroom.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/2.25s</color></size>

plants.name: Repeat-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Who am I? The double-shot holds the answer!" exclaims the little Repeat-shroom, proudly flaunting the twin leaves atop its head. With double the firing rate and double the cheer, these spirited beings thrive in groups, eagerly pouring their firepower onto the battlefield, showcasing that size doesn't define their strength.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Repeat-shroom can fire two small peas at a time.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/2.25s</color></size>

plants.name: Buckshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I carry my ancestors' spirit—I won't fall here!" Buckshooter declared. When told his helmet looked like Buckethead Zombie's, he retorted, "Then let's invoke their will and ride again!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Buckshooter has the ability to crack armor.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. Recovers 500 Resistência when fed metal object.
<color=black>•</color> Takes half the Dano from explosive cherries.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles knock back zombies and instantly break screen doors.</color></size>

plants.name: Nut-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Nut or mushroom? Why worry about labels? Nut-shroom isn't about to tell you it's actually a matsutake in disguise anyway.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Nut-shroom can be your stalwart defender despite its size.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Hypno-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"As a kid, I believed zombies were nothing more than fairy tale monsters," Mini Hypno-shroom said softly. "Now, don't get it twisted—I'm just restoring them to the fairy tale form they were always supposed to have."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shrinks a zombie and makes it fight for you!

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Makes a zombie smaller (cuts Resistência to 70%) and fight for you.</color></size>

plants.name: Perfume-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The colorful Perfume-shroom makes a grand debut! With a blast of perfume, it can turn zombies around in an instant. Some claim it's a secret technique passed down by the mushroom family, while others believe it's a cutting-edge military weapon. Perfume-shroom just smiles and says, "It's all thanks to Hypno-shroom helping me rinse my mouth everyday."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Perfume-shroom sprays fumes that can hypnotize zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s (Piercing) </color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Chance to hypnotize zombies with less than 50% Resistência. The lower the zombie's HP, the higher the chance, up to 25%.
<color=black>•</color> Hypnotization threshold is removed for zombies already hit by Trippy-shroom.</color></size>

plants.name: Trippy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Scaredy-shroom has always been afraid of zombies. In order to reduce her fear, Hypno-shroom tells her a bedtime story every day: "Actually, there are good people among zombies." Over time, Scaredy-shroom was finally brainwashed. Now she can use spores to brainwash zombies. Of course, she is still very afraid.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Trippy-shroom can fire spores in 7 colors.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Randomly fires 1 of 7 types of spores. When a zombie is hit by all 7 types of spores, it will be hypnotized. Each time it is hit by a type of spore, the hypnotize probability of the Perfume-shroom will increase.</color></size>

plants.name: Gutsy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Courage fills me, no fear remains~ Whether it's spring, fall, winter, or summer~" Gutsy-shroom no longer shrinks in the face of zombies. "I used to tremble, but Senior Fume-shroom told me, 'If a zombie gets near, spray your spores. Hiding won't solve anything.'"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gutsy-shroom is ready to take on the zombies, near or far!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>36×2/1.5s (Long Alcance); 36/1.5s (Short Alcance, piercing)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots 2 spores at once. When zombies get within 4 tiles in Alcance, sprays piercing fumes instead.</color></size>

plants.name: Charm-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Charm-shroom speaks with a soft smile, "Each spore carries my love, and when they bloom, it's like a spring breeze caressing the air." She even twisted her head into a heart to express her feelings. Her eyes shine with sincerity, hoping that maybe, just maybe, the zombies will understand her love.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Charm-shroom can fire explosive Charm spores.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>120/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals 40 no-falloff splash Dano in a cross shape. Has a chance to hypnotize zombies with < 60% Resistência (ignoring Type 2 armor).</color></size>

plants.name: Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The taller you are, the more powerful you become." Tall-nut firmly believed in this, which is why he always stayed on the front line. Other plants would urge him to take it easy, but he'd just smile and say, "It's fine, I'm tall. As long as you fight quickly, the zombies won't have time to eat all of me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tall-nuts are heavy-duty wall plants that can't be vaulted or jumped over.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Tall plant. Blocks Pole-vaulting Zombies, Dolphin Riders and Pogo Zombies. Cannot block Yeti Riders and charged Pogo jumps.</color></size>

plants.name: Football-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Football-nut looked fierce, causing some small plants that didn't know the truth to feel scared by his appearance. However, the plants that understood Football-nut knew that beneath his serious exterior lay a strong determination to protect his companions. The stolen helmet undoubtedly boosted his confidence.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Football-nut is able to hold a huge amount of Dano.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. Can be fed metal objects to restore 500 Resistência.
<color=black>•</color> Tall plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Buck-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plants hold conflicting feelings about Buck-nut. As an exemplary soldier, he executes orders with unwavering precision, yet his cold demeanor leaves much to be desired. The rust at the corners of his mouth hints at a storied past. In the quiet moments, however, Buck-nut wrestles with an unspoken worry: "How do I prevent rust in a humid garden?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blocks the zombies' advance with a wall of iron.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Can be fed corresponding metal objects to restore 500 Resistência. This also applies to other Metal Plants. All metal plants receive half the Dano from explosive cherries.</color></size>

plants.name: Repeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Unlike his bright and cheerful brother, Repeater leads a carefree life—until it's time to fight. He secretly mastered the art of double shooting but kept it hidden from Peashooter. "I just want him to live happily, without ever needing to learn these battle skills."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Repeater fires two peas at a time.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s</color></size>

plants.name: Sun-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sun-shroom hates sun. He hates it so much that when it builds up in his system, he spits it out as fast as he can. He just won't abide it. To him, sun is crass.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sun-shrooms give small sun at first and normal sun later.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15 → 25 / 25 Seconds
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>120s</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Gatling Pea, the big brother of the Pea family, stands tall with his gun barrel, the very foundation of everyone's safety. His back is like a monument on the battlefield, admired by all. Yet, he smiles modestly, knowing that his daily life is actually managed by his younger brother, Peashooter. "I can't live without him," he admits quietly.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Pea shoots four peas at a time.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/1.5s</color></size>

plants.name: Twin Girassól
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Twin Girassól are known as sisters, always working behind the scenes rather than on the battlefield's front lines. Their role is to support everyone from the rear, but make no mistake—you must protect them. If they're harmed, many plants will quietly shed tears.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Twin Girassóls give twice as much sun as a normal Girassól.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25×2/20s</color></size>

plants.name: Snow Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The cold-blooded Snow Pea rarely displays his emotions to other plants. Some say his heart is even colder than the frozen peas he fires. Snow Pea doesn't want to come off that way, but every time he opens his mouth, the bullets he launches plunge the atmosphere around him to freezing temperatures.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Snow Peas shoot frozen peas that Dano and slow the enemy.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each frozen pea inflicts Frio and adds 10 Cryo points. Deals ×4 Dano to frozen zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Icicle-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Icicle-shrooms didn't set out to master refrigeration technology. During a hiking trip, they forgot their quilts and spent an entire night frozen atop a mountain, frost forming on their heads. Later, Snow Pea, captivated by their frosty appearance, gifted them some icicles to complement their new look.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Icicle-shroom fires icicles that slow down enemies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts Frio and adds 5 Cryo points for every icicle hit. Pierce 2 times. Deals ×4 Dano to frozen zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Ice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Smaller in size, same big abilities!" Mini Ice-shroom's signature poker face never cracks as he delivers his jokes, and that might just be why zombies freeze on the spot.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mini Ice-shroom can temporarily freeze zombies they come into contact with.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes zombies that eat it in place.</color></size>

plants.name: Frost-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost-shroom stands out among the Fume-shrooms. His study abroad in the freezing Alaskan wilderness made him even cooler—literally. Though he only studied hair design for a few years, he's pretty proud of it.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frost-shroom's fumes can pass through and freeze zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s (Piercing) </color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000> Attacks inflict Frio and add 5 Cryo points.</color></size>

plants.name: Shivery-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Shivery-shroom believes he stands apart from other scaredy-shrooms. Unlike them, he never shrinks in fear and joins in all activities without hesitation. However, that's only because when he gets scared, the air around him plummets in temperature, leaving everyone too afraid to startle him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shivery-shroom fires freezing spores.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict Frio, add 10 Cryo points and deal ×4 Dano to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Freeze nearby zombies when they get near.</color></size>

plants.name: Frost Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost Tall-nut raised its icy spikes high, ready to confront the zombies. Others remarked on how "cold" and "silent" he seemed. Yet, his expression remained unchanged, resolute in his defense against the undead. The truth was his face had simply frozen in place.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tall-nuts with a minty taste. They slow down zombies that bite them.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that bite it are Frioed and accumulate 10 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Tall plant. When affected by the Ice-shroom, heals 1000 Resistência.</color></size>

plants.name: CryoDoom-gumelo
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I will freeze the world, and silence will reign. The extreme cold will disrupt your body's temperature system, so it won't be very painful," CryoDoom-gumelo proclaims. He seldom appears in battle, but when he does, a blizzard follows in his wake. With a flash of white light, even time seems to freeze.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>CryoDoom-gumelo can destroy zombies in the entire screen and freeze time.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes surviving zombies for 5 seconds. Also freezes the level temporarily – no new zombies will appear within 10 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Frostveil-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A frosty beauty? An untouchable flower? Frostveil-shroom couldn't care less. She quietly took care of the frosty ornament on her head, always ready to hand her Frost Tall-nut headgear to the zombies at any time. "They'll appreciate the Frio vibe," she remarks coolly.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>When a zombie eats a Frostveil-shroom, it will transform into a Frost Tall-nut Zombie that will fight for you.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon contact turns a zombie into a Frost Tall-nut Zombie that will fight for you. Also freezes the full field.</color></size>

plants.name: Frenzy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>While some plants instinctively bury their heads when nervous, Frenzy-shroom thrives on excitement. His adrenaline spikes, causing his spores to fire at an increasing rate. It's wise to avoid provoking him again, or he might explode from all that pent-up energy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frenzy-shroom's attack speed increases as it attacks.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds (0.25 Minimum)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack will shorten the attack interval by 0.1 seconds, to a minimum of 0.25 seconds. Resets when zombies get near. Will explode when zombies get near while peak attack speed is reached.</color></size>

plants.name: Soot-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Soot-shroom, the misanthropic workaholic, can't stand the sight of zombies—too much of a distraction. He's got a small stash of bullets, but they're more than lethal enough. "Don't bother me unless it's urgent. If you want them dead, just shoot them yourself." Still, his sharp efficiency keeps everyone looking up to him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Soot-shroom can destroy most zombies in front of it.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800/36s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Click manually to attack all zombies in a row.</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Doom-gumelo
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Mini Doom-gumelo may be small, but his temper is explosive. Disagree with him, and he might blow up—no eye contact needed. It's best to admire him from afar—just don't get too close, or things might get messy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mini Doom-gumelo will explode when it comes into contact with a zombie.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Will explode when zombies get close.</color></size>

plants.name: Curse-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants have always wondered why zombies can't be killed for good. Recently, Curse-shroom uncovered the mystery: "I didn't really do much," it said modestly. "I just kindly helped the zombies activate their backup hidden power source. Doesn't that red zombie look Especially harmless? I did warn them, though."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies that eat the Curse-shroom will get hypnotized, and explode after death.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that eat the Curse-shroom will be hypnotized and cursed. The cursed zombie will explode like a Doom-gumelo upon death/leaving the lawn.</color></size>

plants.name: Doomspike-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost has wrapped around his body, stripping away the innocence of his youth. His eyes, colder and deadlier than any gun's barrel, now only show disdain for his enemies. He's become the reaper, the end of the line. Anyone caught in his frosty sights would do well to leave one less meal prepared at home.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doomspike-shroom can fire explosive ice cones.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/3s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Add 10 Cryo points to zombies each hit. Deals ×4 Dano to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Pierces 2 times. Splashes for 10 Dano without falloff within Alcance of 1 tile.</color></size>

plants.name: Esmaga-spreader
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"He has three heads, and his base isn't even a leaf! He looks nothing like a regular pea!" Many plants cower at the sight of Esmaga-spreader's peculiar appearance. Yet, Esmaga-spreader remains unfazed. He thrives in his vibrant life, battling zombies, reading voraciously, playing chess, and winning every pool skipping contest.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Esmaga-spreader can fire small bouncing Esmagaes.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Every time a mini-Esmaga hits the ground, it inflicts 40 points of Dano to nearby zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Spike-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spike-nut is always glaring, always frowning. "I need them to know I'm not a snack," he insists. The zombies, however, just laugh—because when has a Wall-nut ever been scary? Then they take a bite. Then they learn. The hard way.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spike-nut punctures the tires of approaching Zombonis!!

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Reflects 50 Dano back to zombies biting it.
<color=black>•</color> Punctures incoming tires in exchange for 500 Resistência. It cannot protect against submarines or being stomped by Gargantuars.</color>

plants.name: Spicy Kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Passion is like fire," and Spicy Kelp knows this saying all too well. No amount of water can quench their fervent flames! Too bad, the nearby zombies can only feel the heat of the "grilling". Look at them, they have already turned to ashes in this relentless fire!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy Kelp will burn the entire row of zombies upon contact.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown) + 1800 (Cremação)</color></size>

plants.name: Mangle Kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Mangle Kelp stands out as a true philosopher among plants. It often ponders profound questions like, "Where does the grass come from, and where does it go?" However, its disregard for personal hygiene and unkempt hair make other plants shy away, preferring to keep their distance.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mangle Kelp can drag three zombies into the water.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown) ×3</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Drags three zombies into the water. Each drag also deals 600 Dano to nearby zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Kelp-spreader
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Kelp-spreader basked in the sun, his eyes scanning the horizon. "Many plants are scared of my gaze," he chuckled. "But they'd understand if they had to wear three pairs of sunglasses for protection like I do!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fire kelps that slow down aquatic zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s + Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 1 Tangle value.</color>
<color=#006400>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Slows targets and stackable with Frio. Zombies affected receive more and more additional percentage Dano from kelps based on the zombie's Tangle Value, until they're insta-killed when the Tangle Value is full (36).</color></size>

plants.name: Infernowood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's sweltering out here!" Infernowood fumed. Convinced that the intense weather was to blame for its skin, it noted how the flames on its head had also turned a vibrant red. Maybe it was the perfect time to kick off a summer adventure called the "Sledding Tour."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Infernowood can provide an even stronger Dano boost to projectiles!

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Explodes like a Jalapeño upon death.
<color=black>•</color> Ignites projectiles for the following effects:
	-Peas, Potatoes and Low-tier Ignited Peas:
	  +40 Dano
	-Frozen Peas: Turn into regular peas
	-Cherries, Bucks, Suns: ×4 Dano
	-Queen Endoflame's attacks:
	  Now drop 15 Suns instead of 5.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 40 Dano-over-time to nearby zombies every 1.5s.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorchwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>High temperatures and spiciness always go hand in hand. Scorchwood may not grasp this concept, but his years of working at the barbecue stall have certainly infused him with a distinctive heat.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Projectiles ignited by the Scorchwood has greatly increased power.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Explodes like a Jalapeño upon death.
<color=black>•</color> Ignites projectiles for the following effects:
	-Peas, Potatoes and Low-tier Ignited Peas:
	  +36 Dano
	-Frozen Peas: Turn into regular peas.</color></size>

plants.name: Spicy Esmaga
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm not as impatient as my brother," Spicy Esmaga stated calmly. "He rushes through everything, but I've learned that true success comes from patience and careful observation. Sometimes, it's best to wait and let the fire simmer."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy Esmaga can burn a whole row of zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000> 1800 (Single Tile) + 1800 (Lane + Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Releases Jalapeño effect when crushing zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Torchthree
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Why is Torchthree so rich?" the plants frequently pondered. "Oh, it's no big deal," he shrugged. Torchthree then produced three peas from his hair and added, "I used to work as a magician in a circus."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Splits flaming peas into at most 3 lanes.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
Ignites peas:
<color=black>•</color> 1st ignition is exactly like Lareiras;
<color=black>•</color> 2nd ignition splits into two peas on the rows above and below;
<color=black>•</color> 3rd ignition splits into three peas across all three rows;
<color=black>•</color> The cycle repeats.</color></size>

plants.name: Torch-kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Fire struggles to exist beneath the water, which means I can't use my flames to light the way," Torch-kelp admitted. "But once above the surface, my flames can shine once again."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ignites kelp shots and drags one zombie into the water.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignites peas and kelp shots for +20 Dano. Ignited kelp shots can add 1 Tangle Value to all zombies in the splash Alcance. For every 100 shots lit, a Hot Emaranhalga is spawned in front.</color></size>

plants.name: Hot Esmaga
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hot Esmagaes jumps out from the Esmaga Lareiras one by one, "It's getting hot in there; our entire body is melting!" they declared.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Just a Esmaga roasted and glazed with delicious sap.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Cannot be used for fusions.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorched Trêsvilha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Why does Jalapeño always get all the credit?" Scorched Trêsvilha exclaimed, smoke escaping from his mouth. "If they only realized that fusing with Jalapeño burns your peas." He turned to Lareiras with a serious look. "Trust me, you wouldn't want to munch on charred peas!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Trêsvilha who can't fuse because he's scorched.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a line of flames that deal 1800 (Cremação) Dano in three lanes when planted or fused.</color></size>

plants.name: Esmagawood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's way too hot! Too hot!" Esmaga yelled, trapped in the flames of Lareiras. "Who put me here? I should be Esmagaing zombies, not being the punchline at a barbecue party!" The heat was overwhelming, and as he reached his breaking point, he ignited, bursting forth from the torch to rejoin the battle against the zombies.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces a Esmaga in front for each 60 peas that pass through it.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Every time 60 peas are lit, a Esmaga will be planted in front.</color></size>

plants.name: Spikerock
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spikerock just got back from a trip to Europe. He had a great time, met some wonderful people, really broadened his horizons. He never knew they made museums so big, or put so many paintings in them. That was a big surprise for him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikerocks pop multiple tires and hurt any zombies that step on them.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Can puncture tires, but deducts 50 Resistência. Loses 50 Resistência when slammed on by Gargantuars and loses 150 when stomped on by Mech Gargs.</color></size>

plants.name: Torchweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm Torchweed, the zombies' passionate barbecue chef! Ignite that little pea, and I'll throw them an unforgettable barbecue party. Rest assured, I'm a professional—I guarantee it will be crispy on the outside and tender on the inside!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Torchweed can ignite small peas and puncture vehicles.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Ignite small peas for increased, and splashed, Dano.
<color=black>•</color> Every time 100 small peas are lit, a Hot Erva-espinho will be planted in front.
<color=black>•</color> Can also pop the balloons of regular Balloon Zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorchweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Studies reveal that spiciness is actually a type of pain," Scorchweed announced, rattling the red thorns on his head. "I intend to let the unbelieving zombies experience this reality for themselves."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Scorchweed pops tires and enflames zombies that step on them.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict Enflamed Debuff.</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000> Dano taken increases by 50%; zombies with this debuff explode on death, spreading it further.</color></size>

plants.name: Esmagaweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Huh? Yeah." This catchphrase belongs to Esmagaweed, who rarely speaks and often leaves others feeling uncertain. After dinner, the topic of thorns always becomes a favorite among the plants. It's said that on an ordinary afternoon, as Esmaga prepared to crush a nearby zombie, he overlooked the thorns lurking beneath its feet.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies will be knocked back every time it attacks.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack will knock back zombies and fire 1 bouncing mini-Esmaga.</color></size>

plants.name: Weed-spreader
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Weed-spreader rose to fame on Tumbler with his viral posts on weeding techniques, but when fans tried them near their lawnmowers, jammed engines and smoking hoods ensued. "Effective, not vehicle-safe," he shrugged.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires 3 weeds that deal enhanced Dano to vehicles.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>5×3/1.5s (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Weeds deal 36% maximum Resistência Dano to vehicles at the cost of themselves.</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"We're off to join the army!" the three little mushrooms shouted with joy. Although their heights didn't meet the requirements and locating small helmets was a struggle, these challenges couldn't hold back the Gatling Pea-shrooms. United as one, they set their sights on becoming the top trio in the army.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can be stacked three times to shoot 12 small peas at once!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/2.25s</color></size>

plants.name: Krakerberus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Krakerberus possesses a contemplative heart. If you hand him a glass of root beer, be prepared for a discourse on Nietzsche's or Kant's works.Although he has profound musings, sometimes he longs for lighthearted conversations.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires kelp that bounce upon contact and slow down water zombies, can also drag 3 zombies under the water.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/3s + Insta-kill (Drown) ×3</color>
<color=#006400>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Kelp bounce upon contact, dealing 40 Dano to nearby zombies when they land. Adds 1 Tangle Value upon contact.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Can drag 3 zombies under the water.</color></size>

plants.name: Cattail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Woof!" says Cattail. "Woof woof woof! Does this confuse you? Do you expect me to say 'Meow' like a cat because the word 'cat' is in my name and I also look like a cat? That's not how things work around here. I refuse to be pigeonholed."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cattails can attack any lane and shoot down balloon zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s</color></size>

plants.name: Frost Cattail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm not just a cat... I'm... I'm a super blue cat!" declared Frost Cattail. "Do you have some cold catnip...?" His love for catnip shines through, and he has an undeniable fascination with all things cool.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frost Cattail can attack any zombie in the lane and deal extra Dano to Frioed targets.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×2 Dano to Frioed zombies. Deals ×4 Dano to frozen zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Flame Cattail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"When I was young, I thought I'd be a regular Cattail," Flame Cattail said, warming her tail with pride. "Turns out, I'm a blazing inferno of awesomeness!" Frost Cattail sighed from the corner, muttering, "Showoff."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Flame Cattail can attack zombies in any lane and deal high Dano.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×3 Dano to Enflamed zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Gloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've always enjoyed releasing heavy fumes," says Gloom Shroom. "I know a lot of people aren't cool with that. They say it's rude or that it smells bad. All I can say is, would you rather have your brain eaten by zombies?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gloom-shrooms fire heavy fumes in an area around them.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/1.9s (Piercing)</color></size>

plants.name: Embergloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Embergloom-shroom's ability to release hot steam has established him as a celebrated pastry baker. His signature spicy pastries are a favorite among many, cherished for their distinct flavors.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases high-damaging ember fumes around it.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×4/1.9s (Piercing)</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts the Enflamed debuff when attacking zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Snowgloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dreaming of a career as a physicist, the Snowgloom-shroom dedicates his days to unraveling the complexities of the world, avoiding contact with other plants. "Why do I have multiple strings of ice cones sprouting from my head?" he muses, the latest question occupying his thoughts. He's oddly adamant about calling them "strings."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases cold fumes around that can freeze zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×4/1.9s (Piercing)</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorch Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Scorch Tall-nut is a huge fan of the Olympics and passionately insists that Lareiras be chosen as the Olympic torch. Cautious warning to the uninformed though: do not try to eat him. You may find yourself burning up from the spicy heat.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies will get enflamed when it is bitten.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>When affected by the Jalapeño, heals 3600 Resistência. Inflicts Enflamed debuff and deals 20 Dano to zombies that bite him.</color></size>

plants.name: Spikecicle
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After his return from Alaska, Spikecicle couldn't contain his excitement. Eager to freeze the zombies solid, he relished the thought of "ice" bursting beneath their feet. He made it a point that everyone use the term "ice." His skin still carried the Frio from his Arctic adventure, and his eyes shimmered with the brilliance of unmelting snow.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can puncture tires and freeze zombies.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict Frio and add 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits traits from Spikerock.</color></size>

plants.name: Spikinferno
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Not long ago, Spikinferno traveled to Mexico and was swept away by the vibrant enthusiasm of the locals, quickly falling in love with tacos. Now, he's pouring all his energy into a taco museum alongside Spikecicle, though Spikecicle doesn't seem to share his enthusiasm.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Enflame zombies that step on it and also puncture vehicles.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1s</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Applies the Enflamed Debuff when attacking zombies.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits traits from Spikerock.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Thorn-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"People often ask about my appearance, so let me clarify: I'm from the Namib Desert," Sea Thorn-shroom said to anyone who inquired. "If you're familiar with geography, you'll know that a desert can be found right next to the ocean!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attack flying zombies and airships, growing in size after a while.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20 → 20×4/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>120s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Sun-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Sadly, I am a mushroom, not a flower, so I can't be called a sea flower or anything similar," Sea Sun-shroom admitted.
