"At times, this brings me down, but don't let it bother you. I may not be a Girassól, yet I can still use different physical and chemical reactions in the water to bring you sunshine!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces increasing amounts of Sun as it grows.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15 → 25 → 50/15s</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>20 Seconds → 40s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Lamp-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've been a light system at a pirate pool party, worked for an Amazon deep-water salvage company for three months, and even served as night fishing bait while I was sleeping!" Sea Lamp-shroom shared, a mix of anger and pride evident in his voice. "Now, I'm looking for a stable job. Uncle Dave mentioned that the backyard pool needed lighting, but he forgot to mention it was infested with zombies!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dispels fog and give light, growing in size after a while.

<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gives 1 Lumos Level to a 3×3 area, then 5×5 after growth.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Inherits traits from Planterna.</color></size>

plants.name: Lumos Cato
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"My adventures in the desert have made me remarkably brilliant," Lumos Cato boasted, but he never forgot to replenish his lamp oil each day to ensure he continued to shine.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing spikes and lasers, depending on the Lumos level.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>36/1.5s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gets the following buffs depending on the Lumos Level:
<color=black>•</color> Level 1 = Pierce 2 Times
<color=black>•</color> Level 2 = Infinite Pierce Laser, Air Dano ×3
<color=black>•</color> Level 3 = Base Laser Dano → 40</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots 2 times at once when attacking flying zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Glowver
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The silver candle illuminates the cold autumn canvas, while the light silk fan dances gracefully with the fireflies." This is Glowver's beloved poem. His fascination with fireflies began in childhood, and he often enjoys the cool breeze by the water at night, admiring how their fluorescence rises gently from the wind, twinkling before softly falling back into the dark grass. Only zombies would overlook such exquisite beauty.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dispels fog and increases the Lumos level of Lumos plants present.

<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gives 1 Lumos Level for Lumos plants in the entire field for 36 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Starglow
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Stars dance on the water as fishing lights prepare to rise into the sky. The waves carry away the moon while the tide brings forth the stars. As a child, Starglow dreamed of picking the stars, often gazing at their shimmer on the water. Meeting Planterna taught her that one need not envy the brilliant stars above; even the faintest light, like fireflies, has its own warmth and beauty.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots stars that can track zombies if there's light.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>60×5/3s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gets the following buffs: 
<color=black>•</color> Level 1 = Stars can now track zombies in the same row.
<color=black>•</color> Level 2 = Stars are fired continuously regardless of zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Level 3 = Stars track zombies everywhere.</color></size>

plants.name: Cato Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cato Drones always move in groups, chirping arrogantly and looking down on others. The other plants are curious what such tiny creatures could possibly do, but the Cato Drones remain unfazed: "If butterflies can stir up a storm, then of course we're far more powerful."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spits out thorns to attack zombies in the sky. Does not occupy any grid.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>36×2/1.5 seconds (Stationary), 36×2/1 Second (Wingman)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. Can be planted on top of another plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Star
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Though my name resembles that of an animal, it's just a stage name," Sea Star explained. "I'm a magician who can expel spores of various shapes." He harbors a deep dislike for diving zombies, worried they'll uncover the truth: he's simply a sea-shroom with a star-shaped water gun perched on his head.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks twice when fully grown.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5 → 20×5×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60s</color></size>

plants.name: StarTrêventoinha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Gather the stars around me and give them to those wishing upon a shooting star," StarTrêventoinha proudly declares, believing it to be a noble mission. However, not everyone appreciates it—Especially when the star shower comes flying directly at them.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attracts stars to rotate around itself and launch them out.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts nearby star projectiles. After 1.5 seconds, shoots them out as tracking projectiles with twice the speed. If the projectiles already have tracking abilities before the acceleration, their Dano is increased by 50% instead. Attracts up to 20 stars maximum.</color></size>

plants.name: Starthorn
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Starthorn has always been a bit of an oddity. The plants joke, "He's always on the ground but only fights the flying zombies. Why doesn't he go after the ground ones?" Starthorn, ever patient, says nothing, quietly protecting his secret: his poor vision only allows him to see the sky when he lies down.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can only attack zombies in the sky.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Thorny stars track flying zombies across the board.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Blow-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sea Blow-shroom has aspirations as grand as a dragon's. Mastering the ancient art of "Feng Shui" from the East, he is well aware of both lucky and unlucky positions. Understanding that wind and water complement each other, he hopes to keep misfortune at bay, whether soaring in the sky or gliding through the water.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dispels fog and blows back zombies in the water.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels fog and push the zombies in his lane to the rightmost column.</color></size>

plants.name: Jack O' Lantern
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Jack O' Lantern insists that he frequently encounters ghosts, but do they truly exist? Who can say for certain? Perhaps he was simply dragged into another round of Halloween festivities by someone eager for a good scare.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>In a small area, dispels fog and increase the Lumos Level for the Lumos plants inside.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Give 1 Lumos Level in a 3×3 Grid. Restores 150 Resistência per Lumos Level every 15 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Thorny Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thorny Abóbora might look like a distant relative of Abóbora, but its current form comes from a desert adventure with Trêventoinha. StAlcancely enough, it doesn't seem to have visible thorns, yet plants that try to hop into it always get poked, leaving them questioning how it happens.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Counterattacks the zombies that bite it.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Reflects 50 Dano back to zombies biting it.</color></size>

plants.name: Starry Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>People often wonder how many languages Starry Abóbora must know to communicate effortlessly with all the plants. Starry Abóbora smiles and says, "Actually, I only speak Carambola's language, since he's the only one I work closely with."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Helps StarTrêventoinha retain more stars.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Increases the storage limit of StarTrêventoinha to 80, and Gravitron to 240.</color></size>

plants.name: Split Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Split Pea brothers always argued over the best direction to fire—forward or backward. But now they've found a clever solution: just let the peas rebound. Problem solved!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Peas shoot peas forward and backwards.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Peas shot backwards will rebound upon reaching the edge of the screen.</color></size>

plants.name: Windy Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>For Windy Abóbora, looking good is a top priority. He never leaves home without first spending a solid half hour perfecting the leaves on his head, ensuring his style is flawless.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Every so often a Trêventoinha will spawn to blow away the fog.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a Trêventoinha every 36 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Abóbora Lure
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dining out sends shivers down Abóbora Lure's spine. He's always fearful that the iron cutlery will magically stick to his face, turning an enjoyable meal into an awkward experience.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fuse with iron materials from zombies to absorb their properties.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=#666699>Sistema Magnético: </color><color=#8B0000>This plant will deal:
(20 * Amount of Magnetic Plants in System * Zombie Speed) to specific zombies every 6s. Only Zombies with magnetable materials OR mechanical vehicles can be Danod this way. Also, they must not be on the sky or underground. This trait carries into further fusions.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Starlure
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Starlure harbors a lifelong dream: to suck the stars from the sky. He spends every night staring at the starry heavens, imagining the day when his dream becomes reality.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fuse with iron materials from zombies to absorb their properties.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Deals double Dano to iron zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Starjoker
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Starjoker often bore the burden of being seen as a circus clown, which left him feeling discontented. "I may appear comical, but I am, in fact, a superhero," he declared. "I commandeered the zombie's Jack-in-the-Box and put on the hero suit inside!" Perhaps the Magneto-gumelo who aided him in the heist never mentioned where the box came from.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots out stars that explode on contact.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Stars explode to deal a small no-falloff splash Dano upon contact.</color></size>

plants.name: Starpick
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's remarkably pickaxe-like," Starpick commented, a hint of amusement in his tone. "I can feel part of myself nestled in the ground, and it's quite pleasant—unless you're bothered by insects like centipedes." With a cheeky smile, he challenged, "Why not take off my hat? You'll find I'm even more pickaxe-like than you!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starpick hides underground: zombies will not attack it.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Cannot be attacked and do not block zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Starsteel
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>People often use the headshots of Starsteel and Starlure to hype up their relationship, which greatly troubles both of them. In fact, Starsteel just wants to be himself - a star with a heart of stone that is hard to rust.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires stars lined with a metallic coating.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Breaks Type 2 armor instantly.</color></size>

plants.name: Steel Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I wish I were stronger," Steel Abóbora muses. "Maybe if I were made of diamond..." Starsteel smirks and replies, "Even that wouldn't be enough! You'd need to be netherite!" In their spirited banter, they forget a vital truth: they can enchant their own strengths.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Protects your plants with sturdy iron.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Joker Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Whenever I emerge, it signals the arrival of the clown. Everyone wonders what lies within his box, but the outcome remains a mystery. I caught a glimpse once, and that moment changed everything for me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can block explosions caused by Jack-in-the-Box zombies

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Nullifies Jack-in-the-Box explosion Dano, protecting the plant inside.</color></size>

plants.name: Miner Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Abóbora is frequently used to protect the plants in the back from being attacked by miners. Curious about stopping the miners from drilling into the ground, he picked up their pickaxes and studied them. Ultimately, he developed new technology that forces miners to dig their way out of the ground in advance.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can block mining attempts by Digger Zombies.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Forces Digger Zombies to unearth prematurely.</color></size>

plants.name: Lumos Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Honestly, I wish I could be a simple Magneto-gumelo," Lumos Magnet confessed. "That way, I wouldn't have to be in the spotlight constantly or feel the pressure of using one magnet to do the work of two."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attraction Alcance and cooldown time improves depending on the Lumos Level.

<color=black>Magnet Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>15 Seconds (LL0) → 11 Seconds → 7.5 Seconds → 5 Seconds (LL3)</color>
<color=black>Magnet Alcance: </color><color=#8B0000>+1 (LL1) → +2 → +3</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Higher Lumos Levels will significantly shorten the attraction interval and increase the attraction Alcance. When it's Lumos Level 2, the attraction will cause 200 Dano to zombies near the attraction target.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Magneto-gumelo
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The other sea-shrooms couldn't comprehend why Sea Magneto-gumelo could absorb iron to become bigger and taller. "It's simple: E=mc²," he explained, even if most of the energy was lost in the air and went completely unused.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>That's weird... Why does the magnet get bigger as well as he grows?

<color=black>Magnet Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>15 Seconds → 10s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Grows after attracting 3 times.</color></size>

plants.name: Magnet Trêventoinha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants often call Magnet Trêventoinha "Magneto." He confidently casts his favorite spell, "Disarmament!" at the zombies, even though he has no idea how the conversion of wind energy to magnetic energy works behind the scenes.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Suck away all the iron objects present.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attract up to 10 metal objects across the whole field. Takes 1 second to process each.</color></size>

plants.name: Magnethorn
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Magnethorn spent some time studying communications jamming at the Air Force Academy, often bragging to his friends about his stellar grades. What he doesn't realize is that his success was mostly thanks to his father, a high-ranking Air Force commander pulling strings behind the scenes.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can cause high Dano to flying objects.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Deals double the Dano to metallic armor.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 500 Dano to Bucknut-copter Zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Dealing a certain amount of Dano to Airships can cause it to crash, dealing 1000 Dano to zombies near the crash site. Zomppelin = 10 Hits | Kirov Drone = 3 Hits | Kirov Zomppelin = 20 Hits</color></size>

plants.name: Stardrop
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Stardrop's favorite nights? The ones where fog takes a break and lets him chat with the stars. "They totally get me," he says, convinced they're just as drawn to him as he is to them. One day, he's sure, one will drop down and say hello. Until then? He'll keep talking.
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons a meteor that deal devastating Dano.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>60×5/3s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Lumos levels 1 to 3 has the same effect as Starglow. Upon hitting Lumos Level 4, summons another type of meteor that has a separate cooldown from the original meteor.</color>
<color=#666699>Sistema Magnético: </color><color=#8B0000>Each plant connected to the Sistema Magnético will increase the Dano of the stars by 5%.
<color=#6A0C9D>Both systems can increase the Dano of the stars by upto 120, maximum.<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Summons a meteor that hit the ground and explode into stars every 60 seconds. The cooldown can be reduced by connecting other Stardrops together, upto 13 for an improved cooldown of 25 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Snow Repeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Whatever happened to you?" a curious plant asked Snow Repeater. He chuckled softly and said, "I'm still a Repeater at heart. I just forgot to snuggle under a blanket during winter nights."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots two frozen peas in succession.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Snow
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"His hands are cold, his face is cold, his heart is cold, and even his blood is cold… Is he frozen?" someone wondered aloud. Gatling Snow shivered, reassuring the concerned plants, "I'm not frozen! The barrel of my machine gun is still burning hot!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Snow shoot four frozen peas at a time.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color></size>

plants.name: Split Snow
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Don't let his icy facade mislead you; there could be a hidden warmth," someone suggested. But Digger Zombie sneered, "Don't make foolish assumptions. This guy has nothing but cold sides!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots frozen peas forwards and backwards.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Split Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherryshooter crawled out of the trench, bewildered. "Who threw that bomb?" he demanded. "Sorry, brother," Split Cherry replied sheepishly, "I saw you pointing your gun at us and thought you were a zombie."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Cherry shoot cherries forward and backwards.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Sniper Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Admired for her sharp vision and robust strength, Sniper Pea is cherished by her Pea comrades. However, during their formation marches, her gun barrel often finds its way into the backs of their heads, making for some tense moments along the way.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Snipes zombies all over the map to deal massive Dano.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>500/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Headshot once every 6 attacks, insta-killing zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Pump-karrier
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pump-karrier always kept three books on its shelf, their titles concealed from the curious eyes of the other plants. One day, a Cato Drone's curiosity led it into the study, where it uncovered the titles: "Guide to Succulent Plant Cultivation," "Postpartum Care for Abóboras," and "36-Second Cato Quick Flight Tutorial." The Cato Drone chuckled at the unexpected collection.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spawns a Cato Drone that moves around the field to attack flying zombies.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits Thorny Abóbora traits. Always has a Cato Drone wingman with him when he appears. Generates a Cato Drone on top of a 3×3 grid regularly.</color></size>

plants.name: Solar-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some people ask why Solar-pult's little Suns disappear when thrown over the roof's right side. Solar-pult just smiles: "Where do you think the front yard's Suns comes from?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches solar cabbages to attack zombies and can also generate Sun.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>50/5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Returns 100 Sun upon fusion. Each shot bounces once after hitting a zombie. For every 200 Sun, it can bounce one more time; each bounce drops 5 Sun.</color></color>

plants.name: Cabbage Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm not just a pot to hold cabbages, and Couve-pulta is not the weakest plant! Couve-pulta and I are best buddies," Cabbage Pot says confidently. Their friendship might have come to be because... one of them is balding, and the other is already bald.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides a 50% attack speed bonus to Cabbage-type plants above it.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Grants a 50% attack speed boost to Cabbage-type plants.</color>

plants.name: Taco-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Taco-pult always wonders why, despite learning skills from Milho-pulta and performing well on the battlefield, Dave finds it hard to look at him and even avoids him. In truth, it's because Taco-pult resembles a taco too much, and every time Dave sees him, he just wants to pick him up and eat him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches tacos that can bounce once, and can also throw butter.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles bounce once. Has a 1/4 chance to throw butter, dealing 60 Dano and immobilizing zombies for 4 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Kernel Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Kernel Pot believes he's more than just delicious. In his view, buttered corn provides more nutrients than soil, Especially for fungi. Kernel Pot's favorite plant is the Milho-pulta, his favorite food is butter, his favorite container is a cup, and his favorite song is "Buttercup."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Increases the butter chance of all Kernel-type plants above it from 25% to 50%.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Raises the butter chance from 1/4 to 1/2.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Husk
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Protecting the plants around me is my duty." As a professional cosplayer, "Umbrella Husk" is so skilled that no one realizes he's actually a corn cob with a butter wig, who loves to stand on his head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Knocks back zombies that try to approach and immobilizes them with butter.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back nearby zombies, dealing 40 Dano and immobilizes them for 4 seconds at the cost of its Resistência. 
<color=black>•</color> 1 Zombie: -100 Resistência
<color=black>•</color> 2~4 Zombies: -150 Resistência
<color=black>•</color> 5 or more Zombies: -250 Resistência</color>

plants.name: Winter Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Winter Melon once confessed to Melão-pulta, "I wasn't always this frosty. I just went into the freezer for a popsicle one day, and… well, here we are." </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches frosty melons that slow zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Applies 50 Cryo points to zombies hit. Zombies hit in the splash area gain 5 Cryo points. Deals 4x Dano to Frozen zombies.</color>

plants.name: Clove-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"In the 90's, people widely believed that the best way to deal with zombies was with cornmeal and black dog blood. For us plants, Alho is a strategic resource," Clove-pult says with a wise demeanor.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws small cloves at the zombies; sometimes they're buttered.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Each attack accumulates 1 Poison point. 
<color=black>•</color> At 5 points, the Poisoned Debuff is applied.
<color=black>•</color> Has a 1/4 chance to throw Alho butter with 60 Dano, immobilizing zombies for 4 seconds, forcing a lane switch.
<color=#5E1675>Poisoned Debuff: </color>Zombies lose (20×Poison point) Resistência per second while poisoned.</color>

plants.name: Garbage-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The combination of cabbage and Alho is fresh, delicious, and healthy, and it's simple to make. Adding a few cloves of Alho before serving enhances the flavor," explains Chef Alho. Eating Alho is also said to have some effect on preventing hair loss.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches stinky, garbage cabbages at the zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> See Clove-pult for details on the Poison System.
<color=black>•</color> Each time it hits a zombie with Poison Points greater than 0, it can bounce again. There is no limit to the amount of times it can bounce, and each hit adds 1 Poison point.
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Launches a projectile that bounces once.</color>

plants.name: Alho-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Few dare to put on airs in front of Alho-pult. Most take a detour when they see him, though he doesn't intend to be intimidating. He no longer seeks the popularity he had as a chef, but he does hope to make friends who appreciate the benefits of allicin. Now, plants finally embrace his unique charm, Alho and all.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs large Alhos on the zombies that break on impact.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>100/3s</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> See Clove-pult for details on the Poison System.
<color=black>•</color> Accumulates 1 Poison point for all zombies within the Alho's splash radius. Each Poison point adds 5 Dano to splash attacks.</color>

plants.name: Cob Cannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cob Cannon is quite the intellectual powerhouse—rumor has it that it studied at Harvard and once worked at a prestigious law firm in New York. Known for its immense power, a single shot from Cob Cannon can decimate a large area of zombies. However, the true source of its formidable energy remains a mystery.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can be manually operated to launch deadly corn cobs that cause Cremação Dano.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Arming Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Must be planted on top of two Milho-pultas.</color>

plants.name: Corn-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Corn-pult is often seen frowning. When asked why, he says nothing. "People keep asking me if Buttered Corn is sticky or sweet," Corn-pult sighs. "Why ask me? I don't eat it. Only the zombies would know."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws large corns at the zombies; sometimes they're buttered.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw a Buttered Corn with 140 Dano, immobilizing the main target for 4 seconds and zombies in the splash Alcance for (4 / total splash spread) seconds (minimum of 0.5).</color>

plants.name: Pyro Cannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pyro Cannon has a booming popcorn business. The fiery aroma sends zombies running, adding a sizzle to any event. It's even considering a hot pot session with Jalapeño soon.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to fire an explosive, high-Dano flaming projectile that scorches zombies and infuses nearby plants with Jalapeño.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>3640 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts Enflamed debuff and infuses plants in its blast radius with Jalapeño.</color>

plants.name: Cryo Cannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Despite his icy exterior, Cryo Cannon is warmhearted, Especially to friends. In his free time, he enjoys skiing, drumming, and exploring caves. His best party trick? A cold joke to "Frio" the crowd.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to fire a freezing projectile that Danos zombies and infuses plants with Ice-shroom.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>3640 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts Frio and infuses plants in its blast radius with Ice-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Stuffed Melon
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Peel away the green exterior, and you'll find a heart of roses within." This phrase means don't randomly walk into an unfamiliar barber shop—it will be a mind-blowing decision.

Melon Pot: "After finishing a watermelon, wearing its rind on your head is something everyone did as a kid." Vaso remarks, "Honestly, it's kind of silly."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires melons that bounce once.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>

plants.name: Melon Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frugal Melon Pot can't stand to see Melão-pulta throw melons without a thought for cost, so after defeating the zombies, Melon Pot secretly collects the shattered melon fragments scattered on the ground. "This is called soilless cultivation," Melon Pot explained. "Not just any plant can be grown in the ground here; every inch of soil is precious."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Enhances melon-type plants.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Returns an extra 150 Sun on fusion.
<color=black>•</color> Doubles the splash Dano of Melons above it, with no falloff; Dano remains at 2/3 of base Dano.</color>

plants.name: Salad-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"When I was little, everyone asked what kind of Pult I wanted to be," says Salad-pult. "They thought you couldn't have it all. But I decided I wanted everything—even back then."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can catapult mixed projectiles in rapid succession.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>140/5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>42% chance of rapid-firing. Projectiles split into a mix of corn kernels (1/4 chance for butter) and cabbages upon hitting zombies.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Clove
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Come, give Umbrella Clove a hug. You focus on opening the door; let Umbrella Clove handle the rest! The RV doesn't matter; it's the brains inside that count!" Umbrella Clove says. "And one more thing—fight zombies with zombies! And pour some tea for Umbrella Clove while you're at it! Zombies, zombies, go away!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Knocks back zombies and forces them to switch lanes.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back nearby zombies, dealing 40 Dano, at the cost of Resistência, forcing them to change lanes. See Umbrella Husk.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Kale
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>When asked about her secret to success, Umbrella Kale replied, "Actually, I just really enjoy letting balls rest on my head." She paused, "But the other plants all praise me as a top-notch protector."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can bounce catapult-type projectiles to increase their Dano. 

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Prioritized by catapults for targeting. Increases projectile Dano by 75%.
<color=black>•</color> If there are no zombies, it can store projectiles for a while.
<color=black>•</color> Knocks back zombies, dealing 40 Dano, at the cost of Resistência. See Umbrella Husk.</color>

plants.name: Mecha-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some may not realize it, but Wall-nuts have inventors in their community. Inspired by zombie weaponry, they built their own war machines. "Zombie technology, ironically, only destroys itself," says Mecha-nut.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can receive attributes from Jalapeño or Ice-shroom, with effects upon death.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Changes form when affected by Ice-shroom or Jalapeño, healing 3600 Resistência upon transformation.
<color=black>•</color> Releases the current form's effects upon death.
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs Dano for other plants in a 3×3 radius but with the Dano doubled.
<color=black>•</color> Healing can exceed maximum Resistência (up to 4×).
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 1k HP when fed metal object. When metal objects on the lawn disappear and no Giga Mecha-nuts are present, every Mecha-nut restores (1k / total number of Mecha-nuts) HP. </color>

plants.name: Alho Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Alho Pot has long wanted to help the plants in its pot get a thorough sterilization, Especially those on the front lines in direct contact with zombies. However, it seems only Alho-type plants are willing to grow in its pot. "Some plants would rather face zombies than catch my Alho smell," Alho Pot sighed. "Now I can only use Alho to disinfect Alho, and they just say it's a perfect match."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Reduces the biting Dano taken by Alho-type plants on top, and has a Alho effect itself.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Forces zombies to move towards the middle row.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Rind
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Give me a melon; I'll repay you with kindness." Umbrella Rind has always admired this saying from ancient poetry. Plants don't need to bribe him for help—whatever they give, he returns. Well, except basketballs. He's a total basketball fan.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Deflects basketballs and returns a catapulted melon.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Can reflect zombie projectiles back as a melon; loses 200 Resistência for reflecting projectiles that explode.
<color=black>•</color> Each reflection of projectiles stores energy equal to the projectile's Dano, releasing it all on zombies for extra Dano when the next knockback occurs.
<color=black>•</color> Knocks back and deals 80 Dano to zombies at the cost of Resistência. See Umbrella Husk. </color>

plants.name: Titan Melon Mortar
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Titan Melon Mortar is a fervent advocate of the "overwhelming firepower" doctrine: "If one shot doesn't do it, try two, three, or even four!" This approach has made it a powerhouse on the battlefield—and a hit at summer parties.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to launch a barrage of melons from above.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>200 / Melon. Up to 40 melons in a 3×3 area without falloff. Randomly hits within a 5x3 grid.</color>
<color=black>Arming Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36s</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Pot
plants.introduce: Other Vasos are puzzled by the dense foliage of Umbrella Pot, but Umbrella Pot simply says, "I just read the book The Pot's Guide to Hair Care."
plants.info:
<size=36>Enhances umbrella-type plants.

<color=black>Umbrella Husk:</color> <color=#8B0000>+2 Seconds immobilization, +50% knockback distance</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Rind:</color> <color=#8B0000>Doubles Dano of reflected projectiles</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Kale:</color> <color=#8B0000>Can attack zombies on adjacent lanes
<color=black>Other Umbrellas: </color><color=#8B0000>Doubles knockback distance</color></color>

plants.name: Silver Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Besides a shiny silver exterior, Silver Cabbage also has a heart of silver. Silver Cabbage dreams of becoming a teacher and already has a catchphrase in mind: "Silver Cabbage Instructor, at your service."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches silver cabbages to attack zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>

plants.name: Golden Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Cabbage isn't just about its dazzling appearance—it has a heart of pure gold. It relishes fighting alongside plants against zombies and dreams of one day being honored as the "Heroic Cabbage of Gold."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks zombies by throwing golden cabbages. Its ultimate move unleashes cabbages on all zombies!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 1000 Coins, Cooldown: 2 seconds; throws a cabbage at every zombie, instantly killing those with Resistência below 360.</color>

plants.name: Silver Pot
plants.introduce: "People are always saying 'gold this, silver that,' as if we have a hierarchy," Silver Pot said. "Margarida is silver, yet it's still called a Marigold." His words might have been more convincing if his gaze weren't fixed on the coffee bean by the roof's edge.
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra Coins for you.

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>

plants.name: Golden Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Many wealthy folks treat money like dirt, but I'm different," Golden Pot explains. "That's how I became rich in the first place."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra Coins and amplifies the ultimate ability of any golden plant above it.

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>When you trigger an ultimate of a Golden Plant above it, all Golden Plants on other Golden Pots with an equal or less ultimate cost trigger their ultimates too. </color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Upgrade Custo: </color><color=#8B0000>2000 Coins; each existing Golden Pot will double the cost.</color>

plants.name: Silver Kernel
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Why throw silver coins at zombies? Why, why? Even if zombies are just game data, we still ought to show them some final respects." Silver Kernel was once an usher in a theater, but after discovering his knack for lecturing, he entered the world of public speaking, bringing along his butter and corn kernels.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires silver kernels and silver money bags to attack zombies, with a chance to earn Coins.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw a silver money bag, dealing 60 Dano, immobilizing the zombie for 4 Seconds, and dropping 25 Coins.</color>

plants.name: Golden Kernel
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Kernel ponders words like "golden phrases" and "precious gems." But maybe true treasure lies in imported butter and gold missiles... or "Just Gold."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws golden kernels and butter at zombies, with a chance to generate Coins. Its ultimate fires golden poppin' popcorns at zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>25% chance to throw a money bag, dealing 80 Dano, stunning zombies for 4 Seconds, and dropping 100 Coins.</color>
<color=black><color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 3500 Coins, Cooldown: 2 seconds; launches four golden corn bombs, each dealing 450 Dano in a 3×3 area without Dano falloff.</color>

plants.name: Twin Margarida
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's time to make gold coins!" one of the Twin Margarida sister declares. But the other sister insists, "Now's the perfect time for a silver coin!" Since they can never agree, they each produce their own share independently, which might actually be for the best. "Double opinions, double efficiency—isn't that right?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces double the amount of Coins!

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>Generates Coins twice every 20 seconds, otherwise identical to Margarida.</color>

plants.name: Silver Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Silver Melon sometimes considers itself the most valuable melon—until it remembers the more prestigious Golden Melon. "A melon is a melon, whether it's silver, gilded, or made with Alho or gold," Silver Melon chuckles. "We all have our place in the soil."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches silver melons to attack zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>100/3s</color>

plants.name: Golden Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Melon doesn't mind questions about its golden rind and seeds, but never ask if it's seedless—it has no patience for that question.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hurls golden melons at zombies; its ultimate rains golden melons across the screen.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 3600 Coins, Cooldown: 2 seconds; launches 60 golden melons, each dealing 120 Dano, landing randomly across the screen.</color>

plants.name: Silver Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Silver Umbrella is always anxious about someone stealing his money when he's away, so he carries his fortune with him everywhere—even into battle against zombies. He thinks this keeps his wealth safe, but it only adds new risks. "That's my money; you can't take it!" he complains, though no one ever listens.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra money for you when it deflects basketballs.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops 25 Coins each time it activates and knocks back approaching zombies, dealing 40 Dano, at the cost of Resistência. See Umbrella Husk.</color>

plants.name: Golden Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Umbrella doesn't like this place—after a mishap in the water, it was shipped here alongside Silver Umbrella. The memory still frustrates him. "It's unfair! Why am I the freebie here?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Deflects basketballs, generating extra Coins, and its ultimate move can knock airborne imps and repel all nearby zombies.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops 50 Coins every time it deflects a basketball; knocks back approaching zombies, dealing 40 Dano, at the cost of Resistência. See Umbrella Husk.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 2000 Coins, Cooldown: 7.5 seconds; knocks back all nearby zombies, drops 25 Coins/zombie, restores 1000 Resistência, yeets airborne imps, and drops 3 diamonds.</color>

plants.name: Silver Alho
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Does a Alho made of silver still smell like Alho? Probably not, but neither the plants nor the zombies were eager to test it. However, zombies soon regretted their curiosity after a taste!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Possibly an even more pungent Alho? Maybe.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>600</color>

plants.name: Golden Alho
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Beneath its dazzling exterior lies an unbearable Alho scent. Golden Alho muses, "True value is only in appearance, not in the details." But everyone knows this "golden" Alho is just a regular Alho with a shiny coat.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A stronger, gold-scented Alho that can force all zombies in front to switch lanes with its ultimate move.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>900</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 1000 Coins, Cooldown: 2 seconds; forces all zombies in its lane to change lanes.</color>

plants.name: Hypno-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno-nut has a soft spot for zombies: "There's something oddly pleasant about the way they nibble on me. It's not like scratching an itch… let's just call it affection from prolonged contact," it says, philosophically.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hypnotizes zombies and summons a Hypnotized Mystery-box Zombie every 36 Seconds!

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Each time it's bitten, there's a 4% chance to hypnotize the zombie.
<color=black>•</color> Can recover 100 Resistência when hit by a Trippy-shroom spore, and stores one spore of that color each time it's hit (up to 3).
<color=black>•</color> When it collects 7 different spore colors, it consumes one of each and summons a Hypnotized Golden Mystery-box Zombie, then fully heals.</color>

plants.name: Alchemist Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Alchemist Umbrella is a tycoon among plants, providing jobs for zombies and plants alike. "I maximize their value," it declares with a gilded flourish to its spectacles.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>High-risk, high-reward!

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Has the traits of both Umbrella Clove and Golden Umbrella.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 3600 Coins, Cooldown: 7.5 seconds; inherits traits from Golden Umbrella; knocks back all nearby zombies, turning those with less than 25% Resistência into silver statues worth 1000 Coins, or gold statues worth 3600 Coins if below 10% Resistência. Zombies without statues drop Coins directly.</color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Golden Alho + Umbrella Leaf (or Golden Umbrella + Alho)</color>

plants.name: Summer Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants always feel that red-rinded watermelons carry the festive vibe of New Year, crackling and popping with excitement. But the watermelon explains, 'I didn't put firecrackers in the melon! It's just that sealed food explodes when heated—and you can't rush eating a hot watermelon!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs blazingly hot melons!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts the Enflamed debuff.</color>

plants.name: Gold Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After working countless hours at an accoutant firm, the Gold Magnet realized its terrifying attracting potential and switched careers to become a fighter. 'Honestly, this is way more fun than counting money,' it remarks. 'After all, money doesn't grow on trees, but they do somehow from crops.' That said, its plant companions often end up suffering from its antics.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attracts projectiles!

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts straight-shooting projectiles from adjacent lanes and produces a 25 Coin for every projectile attracted.</color>

plants.name: Giga Mecha-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Giga Mecha-nut has always been passionate about environmental protection. 'I have a love-hate relationship with zombies—they pollute the environment, but they also bring me wealth. Isn't owning property and a trailer the hallmark of success? The lawn is clean all thanks to me!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can store up Resistência and protect your plants.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. Anti-crush. Max Dano received is capped at 8k.
<color=black>•</color> Healing can exceed maximum Resistência without any cap. Spawns with 80× Resistência as initial HP.
<color=black>•</color> Redirects Dano to itself in a 3×3 area.
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 4.8k HP when fed metal object. When metal objects on the lawn disappear, every Giga Mecha-nut restores (4.8k / total number of Giga Mecha-nuts) HP.
<color=black>•</color> Using a Wall-nut on it restores 8k HP instantly and summons a Sharkmarine (stationary if on land with 1/3 the HP of the Giga Mecha-nut).
<color=black>•</color> Can resist being crushed. Dano received is capped at 8000 per hit.</color>

plants.name: Buck-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Buck-shroom has a constant worry: he's terrified of Magneto-gumelo accidentally pulling him in. 'Where did my screws go?' As Crazy Dave walks up, it seems he is about to have a brand-new concern.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Buck-shrooms can knockback zombies too.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/2.25s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Projectiles knockback zombies and destroy screen doors with ease.</color>

plants.name: Split Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The front head declares, 'My turn to use the eyebrow!' The back head replies, 'Guess we'll have to split it.' Born just two minutes apart, their eternal battle over the eyebrow shows no signs of stopping.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots peas both forward and backward.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/2.25s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Backward peas rebound if no zombie is hit.</color>

plants.name: Solar Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Have you heard? Solar Magnet's been glowing with wealth lately! 'I don't produce iron; I just do the delivery,' he says proudly. 'This is all from years of hard work.' Word is, he's even opened business beyond the lawn!' </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces metal objects and turns metal objects to Sun.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a random metal object every 36 Seconds. Drag a metal object on it and it will produce 25 Sun. Produced metal object is automatically given to Kaboom Magnet, Charmo Magnet or Charmatron-shroom directly in front.</color>

plants.name: Hot Erva-espinho
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After the test of fire, he's still the same old Erva-espinho, just wiser, shinier, and ready to give zombies warmer welcome!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hot Erva-espinho? What's the different between him and the cooler Erva-espinho?

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>360</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Cannot be used in fusions.</color>

plants.name: Hot Kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Managing a hot spring isn't easy, but Hot Kelp takes pride in having zero customer complaint. In fact they seem to enjoy their dip a little too much to the point of never returning.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hot Kelp? Does he live in lava or something?

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>360</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Cannot be used in fusions.</color>

plants.name: Charm Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After countless days and nights of research, Charm Magnet finally mastered the art of the magnetic charm field. 'Now I can better persuade zombie friends to fight alongside us,' he said. 'Some think I threaten them with metal tools, but one day, the truth will come to light.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes metal objects and summon the corresponding zombies to fight for you.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Uses metal objects to spawn hypnotized zombies with 40% HP.
<color=black>•</color> Auto-uses metals generated from Solar Magnet behind itself and those consumed by Magneto-gumelos in the same Sistema Magnético.</color>

plants.name: Lure-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>'I used to ferment bread,' Lure-shroom explained, 'but now I collect metal to build the bread ovens.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Putting an Iron Bucket on him might have interesting results.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×2 Dano to Metal Zombies.</color>

plants.name: Rust-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>'I got canned again!' Cries Rust-shroom who used to be Lure-shroom just a moment ago, 'All I did was accidentally making a coffee maker rather than an oven!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>There could be another twist if you give him a Football Helmet?

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>50/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×3 Dano to Type 1 armors.</color>

plants.name: Football-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've always dreamed of being a Football player, and now I've finally got this hat of glory," said Football-shroom proudly. "But today, I've decided to take a break on the sidelines." In reality, he's just a stadium security, keeping the overenthusiastic fans out with his spores.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays fumes that penetrate all kinds of armor!

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>3600</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>60/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals Dano to armor and the zombie in the armor at the same time.</color>

plants.name: Titan Pea Turret
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As one of the ultimate weapons of the Pea family, the Titan Pea Turret is always taught not to lie down without reason. "But my head is really heavy!" Sometimes, when being scolded, he complains like this. Of course, he doesn't know that the Pea elders tell him not to lie down just because it's actually kind of cute when he does.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Unleashes pure pea hell onto zombies!

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>(20×3×2.25)/0.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Fires 3 peas at once.
<color=black>•</color> Firing speed increases the longer the turret fires and has 3 stages. After shooting 100 rounds, attack speed is increased by 50% (to 150%). After shooting another 200 rounds, attack speed is increased by another 50% (to 225% the original).
<color=black>•</color> Firing speed returns to normal when its attack resets.
<color=black>•</color> Peas may miss Imps due to the turret's height.</color>

plants.name: Explod-o-tato Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Explod-o-tato Mine is a top chef, and his "hash cherries" and "potato jam" are highly praised in the plant world. If he runs out of ingredients, he will cheerfully say: "I'll go buy some."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Splits into 8 Potato Mines in surrounding tiles.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Spawns Potato Mines in a 3×3 Alcance upon defeat.</color>

plants.name: Chili Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chili Mine is a capable assistant to Explod-o-tato Mine, but most of her dishes are given low ratings by customers. "What's going on—" Chili Mine feels really guilty but doesn't know why. The truth is, she is not sensitive to spicy flavors and always adds too much chili.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Splits into 7 Potato Mines in her lane. 

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Spawns up to 7 Potato Mines in her lane upon defeat.</color>

plants.name: Pump-Kaboom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pump-Kaboom is a distant relative of Cherry-nut, but every time Pump-Kaboom meets Cherry-nut, he is always late. "I want to come early too," Pump-Kaboom says, "but I can't resist jumping to anything red."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Abóbora that cannot be exploded by cherries!

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to explosive cherries and heals instead (From Explosive Cherry: 200, From Cherry Bomb: 1000).</color>

plants.name: Snow Commando
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the general commander of the Pea family, Snow Commando has an aura that makes plants and zombies shudder even from miles away. But regarding his proud freezing ability, Snow Commando always keeps quiet about it, until one day a small pea accidentally opened his diary: "If I had known, I wouldn't have bet against the fire sniper. Not only did I almost freeze to death in the ice fields, but I also turned into this way. Tonight, I'll make that guy eat three big bowls of chili—"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots Snow Peas at zombies, with a small chance of shooting a massive barrage!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×6/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>3×20/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>3% chance to shoot a barrage of snow peas each attack, lasting 5 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Kaboom Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Selling well is also a skill." said the Kaboom Magnet. Only Magneto-gumelos can turn hate into love. He once hated cherries the most. Actually, he still does, but perhaps he has discovered a business opportunity?</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Transmutes metal objects into explosive cherries!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts metal objects and turns them into explosive cherries. Each object can be turned 5 times before consumption. Metal objects can be actively given to the Kaboom Magnet for it to initiate an attack.</color>

plants.name: Blazer Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Other snipers envy Blazer Pea for being a reliable assistant to the commander, even though she is still a little one. "Talent is one thing, but... I have to thank the commander for cultivating me!~"Blazer Pea says, but in reality, it's because Snow Commando is naturally cold and always keeps Blazer Pea as a warm-up buddy.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can lock onto zombies anywhere on the map!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict the Enflamed debuff and deal 100 Dano to nearby zombies.</color>

plants.name: Pea Commando
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Faced with the crazy zombies and powerful teammates, Pea Commando, who came to the yard for more challenges, feels immense pressure, and his temper is getting worse... However, the plants are always shocked by the extreme violent tendencies of the Pea Commando, who fires peas madly from a distance. Gatling Frenzy-shroom has already decided to ask for his contact information.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots Peas at zombies, with a small chance of shooting a massive barrage!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×6/1.5 Seconds
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>3×20/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>3% chance to shoot a barrage of peas each attack, lasting 5 seconds. You can switch between Pea Commando and Sniper Pea with Peashooter.</color>

plants.name: Titan Abóbora Bunker
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once, a pair of Abóboras dreamed of joining a circus. But after a magnetic mishap left them stuck together, they discovered a better calling: standing their ground as an impenetrable shield. The circus can wait.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Protect two tiles at once!

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>12000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Heals when affected by Cherry and Jack-in-the-Box explosions. Can only be placed on Titan plants.</color></color>
plants.cost: <size=35>Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Joker Abóbora ∞ [Magneto-gumelo] ∞ Pump-Kaboom < Jicamagic (Place On Middle)

plants.name: Nugget-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some plants asked: "Why is the top of Nugget-shroom red?", to which he replied, "Well, let me ask you first..."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can reproduce itself!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Spawns a new Nugget-shroom in the same tile after 20 Seconds. Each Nugget-shroom can only reproduce once. Upon death, it deals 360 Dano to nearby zombies</color>

plants.name: Spuddy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Why does Spuddy-shroom explode after a few attacks? His explanation is quite touching: "Every attack I make is burning my life!" But the truth is—he's just a magician who doesn't want to do much work. After a few attacks, he decides to use a potato firework to perform a grand "fungus" transformation.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes Resistência to fire high-Dano spores!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>600/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack costs 75 Resistência. If kept alive for 20 seconds after being planted, his red light will turn off with attack power reduced by 90%, but attacks will no longer cost Resistência. Upon death, it deals 600 Dano to nearby zombies.</color>

plants.name: Foul-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>With a pale skin, a hairstyle that could rival a cathedral dome and a grin full of crooked teeth, Foul-shroom looks like it's auditioning for the villain in a fairytale. Ironically, he usually gets the role of a vampire.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays poison gas at zombies!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>36/1.5s (Piercing)</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>Attack adds 1 Poison point to zombies.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that bite it are forced to switch lanes.</color>

plants.name: Unstable Jalapeño
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cold on the outside, fiery on the inside. This is how other plants describe Unstable Jalapeño. "Don't be fooled by my calm appearance, my explosive energy is beyond your imagination," murmurs Unstable Jalapeño. Oh, by the way, he's also quite skilled at making ice-cream.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Has both the properties of Ice-shroom and Jalapeño!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>36000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Loses 20% Resistência every 3 seconds. While present, absorbs Dano for all plants. Upon death, triggers Jalapeño in his row and fullscreen Ice-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Titan Chomper Maw
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Titan Chomper Maw won the grand prix in an Gourmet king contest, finishing 10 giga garg cakes in 44 seconds — with 3 of those seconds wasted because he didn't hear the starting whistle. "If there's another event like this, please call me. The buffet near the garden won't let me in anymore," said the Titan Chomper Maw during the interview.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Swallows all zombies that get too close!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> 8 + 3ln(Sum Resistência of Zombies)s</color>
<color=black>•</color><color=#8B0000> For reference: Zombie - 24.8 Seconds | Buckethead - 29.9 Seconds | Giga Gargantuar - 34 Seconds | 10 Giga Gargantuars - 41s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Can swallow all zombies in a 1.5 tile Alcance, including Gargantuars. Unable to swallow other zombies that has immunity to Chompers. </color>

plants.name: Titan Kraken-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sailors whisper of the Giant Kraken of theNorthern Sea, its name alone enough to turn the bravest hearts cold. But Titan Kraken-shroom? He's got no time for legends. He didn't come to terrify—he came to play. And his favorite game? Pushing zombies around like driftwood.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can repel zombies in front.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=#006400>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000> Adds 1 Tangle Value per hit, dealing additional Dano based on the Tangle Value.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Repels approaching zombies (single target) and deal 100 Dano.

plants.name: HypnoTrêventoinha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plants are always curious why HypnoTrêventoinha pulls the zombies back. HypnoTrêventoinha explains: "Since Trêventoinha always pushes zombies to the opposite direction they face, I believe it's only natural for me to do the same to hypnotized zombies."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can pull back hypnotized zombies!

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Pulls all hypnotized zombies back, lasting 5 seconds, but reduces their HP by 10% max Resistência.</color>

plants.name: Twin Não-me-cortes
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Twin Não-me-cortes' two heads are constantly arguing — one swears spinning is the best approach, while the other insists launching saw blades is superior. Somehow, their teamwork still cuts through the competition.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks nearby zombies with its blades and can also strike at a distance!

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>8/0.02 Seconds (Melee); 16/1.5 Seconds (Alcanced)</color>
<color=black>Especial:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> The front head attacks like a regular Não-me-cortes, while the back head targets all zombies on the screen (prioritizing flying zombies).
<color=black>•</color> Gains 5 points of Shield every 0.5s, up to 360 max.</color>

plants.name: Boomwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Boomwood's Afro bounces rhythmically, as if dancing to a beat only it can hear. Some say his groove inspires his fiery creations, while others just appreciate the spectacle — both the style and the explosions leave a lasting impact.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spawns explosive cherry drones that seek out zombies.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Generates a homing cherry drone for every 36 peas that pass through.
<color=black>•</color> Converts any explosive cherry that passes through into a cherry drone.
<color=black>•</color> There can be up to 3 cherry drones at once.
<color=black>•</color> Upon death, it triggers a Cherry Bomb explosion.</color>

plants.name: Bamboom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Business is booming for Bamboom, but the zombies aren't celebrating. Every time a firecracker goes off, they end up singed, dazed, and fuming—literally. "Oh, lighten up," Bamboom teases. "You look great in charcoal black.
plants.info:
<size=36>Propels himself towards the zombies, causing Dano and knocking them back.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>360</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> After being planted, waits for 1 second before flying forward in his lane, knocking back zombies it encounters and causing 360 area Dano each impact.
<color=black>•</color> Deals ×15 Dano to Nian zombies.</color>

plants.name: Frostweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Breaking news from the first Plants vs. Zombies Hockey Tournament! Frostweed skated to victory, leaving the Bobsled Zombies scrambling. But now, they're calling foul! "I did nothing wrong," Frostweed insists, adjusting their icy spikes. "And these springs? Just a little pre-game safety gear."
plants.info:
<size=36>Frostweed can slow down zombies that walk on it.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1 Second</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each hit inflicts Frio and adds 10 Cryo points.</color>

plants.name: Foul Trêventoinha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Foul Trêventoinha used to have a simple life, working at a bustling barbecue joint where business was booming. "Ah, those were the days," it sighs. "Customers used to leave with a green glow of happiness after I blew away the overwhelming Alho. Now? Things just aren't the same."
plants.info:
<size=36>Foul Trêventoinha can poison zombies.

<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts 5 Poison Points to every zombie in the screen and apply the Poisoned debuff. It also increases the time the debuff stays by 5 more seconds.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Forces Zombies to change lanes. </color>

plants.name: Frostburn-wood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"One input, one output. That's the rule." Frostburn-wood prided himself on his structured logic. "That's why I counteract Lareiras's flames with pure, unyielding frost." But put them together? Things got... messy. Fire and ice, heat and cold—sometimes they balanced, sometimes they clashed, and sometimes, well... physics just gave up.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can turn normal peas into snow peas or polar ice peas.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Turns the normal peas that pass through into snow peas, and the snow peas that pass through into polar ice peas for ×2 Dano and ×2 Cryo points.</color>

plants.name: Twinkle-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Twinkle-shroom would be all over Dave's house, on the floor, on the table, on the dinner plate - Dave always forgot about the Doc's reminder - who cares, Daisy loved the gummy vitamins anyway!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A small mushroom that shoots mini-stars.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/2.25 Seconds (Equivalent to the DPS of 10 Peashooters) </color>

plants.name: SunVaso
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"What do you guys think 'Vaso' means, huh?" SunVaso snapped. "Is it a pot for growing flowers? Or is it a pot that is a flower? Either way, let's get one thing straight—I am a flowerpot. End of discussion."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra Sun for you.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15/25s</color>

plants.name: Lumos Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Beyond the fog, she watches, a prophet untouched by mortal blindness. When God willed light into existence, she stepped forth. "By decree of the Almighty, I have come to the land of Seth. The fire looms, but with this sacred light, I shall protect the lost from its grasp."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>It can dispel fog and block bullets.

<color=black>Energy Limit: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Search & Light Alcance: </color><color=#8B0000>3×3</color>
<color=black>Especial: <color=#99582a>Lumos System</color></color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Provides 1 Lumos Level and dispels the fog for the surrounding 3×3 tiles.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes Energy to block projectiles. Each block consumes Energy based on the Dano of the projectile (excluding basketballs).
<color=black>•</color> Restores (25 x Lumos Level) Energy every second, pausing to rest for 5 seconds when it is completely exhausted.
<color=black>•</color> Reduces Energy first to absorb Dano, where 5 Energy = 1 Resistência.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Thorn
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Umbrella Thorn just dropped his latest song, "Prickly Cato." With a hopeful glint in his eyes, he mused, "Maybe one day, people will like me as much as they love roses. I know it won't happen overnight, but I'll keep trying my best."</color>
plants.info: <size=36>Can shoot down flying zombies and repel airships.

plants.name: Silver Girassól
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Who says Girassóls only bask in the sun? Silver Girassól has a knack for more than just growing—she's a master silversmith! With techniques passed down from her brewer, she forges dazzling silverware and jewelry, each piece shimmering with history. As they say, "A brewer's legacy lives on, and elegance never goes unnoticed."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates Sun faster.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15s</color>

plants.name: Golden Girassól
plants.introduce: Standing guard over a trophy had been so last season. Now? She was ready to shine—and not just under the sun. "Look, I love a good tan, but let's be real... I was made for the fight!"
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates Sun faster... faster!

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Every 10 seconds, 50 Sun is accumulated, up to 10,000.
<color=black>•</color> The Sun limit in the level is adjusted to 50,000.
<color=black>•</color> The excess will be stored in the available Golden Girassóls.
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Custos 1000 Coins; makes all Golden Girassóls release their stored Sun.</color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Upgrade Custo: </color><color=#8B0000>3600 Coins; each existing Golden Girassól will double the cost.</color>

plants.name: Frost Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost Wall-nut huffed as he hit the ground again. "Do the janitors ever remember to put up 'Caution: Slippery Floor' signs!?" he grumbled. But in his frustration, he failed to realize something very concerning—he was shrinking.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies that bite him are slowed down.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that chew it will be slowed down and will accrue Cryo points. Frost Wall-nuts can be upgraded to Frost Tall-nuts using a Fertilizer.</color>

plants.name: Abóbora Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once a chip shop owner, Abóbora Mine had a simple business model: cut the fries in half but keep the price the same. The customers disagreed. Now in the Garden, he's offering a different kind of deal—one that ends with a bang. Yet, for some reason, people still bring up his old menu.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A shorter Abóbora.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos). However, non-"short" plants inside it will be hit. Each time it is Danod, a small explosion will occur, causing 500 points of Dano to zombies.</color>

plants.name: Doom Cato
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom Cato is a firm believer in the Art of War of Plants: bide your time, strike hard, and leave nothing standing. Whether it's zombies shambling through the battlefield or armored rats scurrying for cover, one well-placed explosion is all it takes to turn the tide.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires destructive thorns.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack has a 0% starting chance of unleashing an Ultimate attack. If it fails, the chance is increased by 5% for the next attack.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots a large number of thorns forward, which can hit airborne units.</color>

plants.name: Doom Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>In the Chomper's Big Eater Championship, Doom Chomper was a force to be reckoned with—until he took things a little too far. "He didn't just eat his cake—he incinerated mine!" a fellow contestant recalled. Unsurprisingly, he was disqualified for excessive destruction.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Devours a zombie to produce a Doom explosion.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
