<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Each time it successfully bites a zombie, a Doom-gumelo explosion is released, causing a crater to appear in front of it.</color>

plants.name: Flame-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the head chef of the restaurant, performing a fiery dragon dance on the teppan is a must-have show for every dinner. But every time, at least one guest ends up getting burned. Word has it that to make up for it, the Flame-shroom gave them an encore performance.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Flamethrower incarnated.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>33/1.5s (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals fire Dano and inflicts Enflamed debuff.</color>

plants.name: Doom Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom Pea and Frenzy-shroom are great friends—one's a hothead, the other’s laid-back. But together, they're the perfect pair. "We may be opposites, but we bring out the best in each other."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Dano-scaling Peashooter and the perfect partner for Frenzy-shroom.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Dano increases by 1 each attack, up to 60. If a Frenzy-shroom is planted 1 tile behind it, Doom Pea gains Frenzy-shroom's attack speed and Frenzy-shroom gains Doom Pea's attack Dano.</color>

plants.name: Lumos Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Lumos Pot always emits a warm glow, so it is often used as a nightlight. If you look closely, you will also find a small inscription on the edge of the pot that says, "Firefly habitat, please do not disturb."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Vaso that can be used as a small Planterna, providing 1 Lumos level for its tile.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels a small patch of fog, providing 1 Lumos level for its tile.</color>

plants.name: Spring Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Holding your breath, focusing, and striking with precision!" Spring Melon is very patient, always waiting for the perfect moment to make a move. If you ask him how he manages to stay calm, he will always mention his mentor, the Imitator.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A big shroom with coiling vines that lob watermelons after charging.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>120/4s</color>
<color=black>Alcance: 4 azulejos à frente</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Charges when not attacking, increasing the Dano of the next attack by 60 per second of charging.</color>

plants.name: Sparkwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After graduating from university, Sparkwood returned to the mountainous region to teach. "From the moment I received an education, I understood that knowledge is meant to be passed on like a 'spark'!" The flame of knowledge ignited the students' enthusiasm and also the zombies.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Lareiras shaped like a Carambola, ignites star projectiles.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignites passing star-shaped projectiles (except thorn stars and jack-in-the-box stars), adding 20 Dano and removing their other traits. Ignited stars do splash Dano in a similar way to ignited peas.</color>

plants.name: Spicy Carambola
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spicy Carambola silently glares, while the other Carambolas keep their distance: "He looks too scary." But Spicy Carambola doesn't care; he is focused on creating an ultimate piece of art. He firmly believes that when he finally blooms, everyone will take notice.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Explodes and releases high-Dano spicy stars.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>600 × 25</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not trigger the Jalapeño effect Immediately when fused. Explodes instead 1 second after fusion, releasing Jalapeño effect and exploding into 25 spicy stars.</color>

plants.name: Doomwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Whenever someone asks Doomwood, "What's the secret to grilling?" he just silently collects and repurposes the embers. It's not that he's indifferent; if he spoke, you'd just end up with a face full of ash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doomwood keeps burning even after a Doom-gumelo explosion and it takes burning to the next level.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When its Ember value is 0, it behaves the same as Lareiras.
<color=black>•</color> When the Ember value is not 0, turns peas and regular ignited peas into ember peas, with +36 Dano and a no falloff 1/3 splash Dano. Ember peas inflict the Ember debuff.
<color=black>•</color> Can also use 10 Ember values to strengthen Doom peas or mini Doom-gumelo projectiles, ×2 or ×6 their Dano respectively, and to enhance their splash effect to be the same as the large bullet of doom.</color>
<color=#7363fc>Ember value: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Initial: 60, Maximum: 60, 1 point is lost per second.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 60 points for every 60 projectiles ignited, 36 points when affected by Doom-gumelo explosions, and 10 points when any zombie within a 5×5 area dies with the Ember debuff. 
<color=black>•</color> Ember debuff will be cleared by cold/frozen/poisoned status and coexists with the Enflamed debuff.</color>

plants.name: Scareless Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Trust me, it's very safe inside." Scareless Abóbora gently reassures Scaredy-shroom, as the built-in phonograph and fairy tale books help them no longer worry about the zombie horde.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Abóbora with the color of the Scaredy-shroom. Scaredy plants inside the Abóbora will not be afraid.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Scaredy plants inside the Abóbora will not be afraid (Frenzy-shroom and Gatling Frenzy-shroom will not self-destruct).</color>

plants.name: Starry-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Guys in the distance, no matter who you are, except for the circus people, don't come over!" The Starry-shroom, trembled, "I, I am very powerful!" He kept attacking, thinking that this would scare off those with ill intentions, but he didn't notice that his bullets weren't even hitting straight ahead.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starry-shroom shoots stars faster and in 5 directions, but also gets frightened more often.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/0.75s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks in the same way as Carambola, but become afraid if there is a zombie in its Alcance.</color>

plants.name: Esmagaed Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Esmagaed Abóbora has never met a match in arm wrestling, has diligently learned various techniques for skipping stones, and is very good at selecting stones—his only bane is that he is very afraid of water and can only watch others skip stones.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The cozy nest of Esmagaes. When there are specific plants in the shell, it can spawn Esmagaes.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>225</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Does nothing in Water Lanes.
<color=black>•</color> Esmaga plants in Esmaga Abóboras lose their ability to detect enemies.
<color=black>•</color> When there are Esmaga or Esmagawood plants in Esmagaed Abóbora, a baby Esmaga with 225 Dano and a maximum jump distance of 1.5 Tiles is spawned. It disappears after 6 jumps and regenerates after 3 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Baby Esmagaes spawned from Infernal Esmagawood releases the Jalapeño effect when it lands.</color>

plants.name: Popcorn-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The results of this experiment: dense planting is not conducive to plant growth, and the corn ears have obviously shrunk." Dave bent down, took out a magnifying glass, and looked at the Popcorn-pult, "Not suitable for making corn rolls anymore." Popcorn-pult said angrily, "The results of this experiment show that the concentrated ones are all the essence!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A tiny Milho-pulta, with a chance to throw a small butter that shrinks zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 25% chance to throw a small butter that deals 40 Dano, which shrinks the size and health of non-shrunken zombies by a factor of 0.7, otherwise it will be stunned for 1.5 seconds, while Imps are killed instantly. Prioritizes zombies that are not shrunken.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Hoverleaf
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After resigning, Umbrella Hoverleaf embarked on a journey around the world. "Sailing with the wind to the places your heart desires, isn't that very romantic?" He compiled his experiences into a book, which received praise from all walks of life.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A smaller floating Umbrella Leaf that can only protect the 1 Tile below.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. He shares the same traits as Umbrella Leaf, but can only protect the plant right below it.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Abóbora
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Many plants were curious about how Hypno Abóbora had only subdued one zombie. "I'm a dedicated person, so of course I need a dedicated zombie," Hypno Abóbora said, scratching his head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hypno Abóbora makes a hypnotized zombie stay by your side.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/12 chance to hypnotize zombie eating him. Forces up to 1 hypnotized zombie to stay in his tile, and use that zombie as a shield first when under attack.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Shell
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Umbrella Shell is the trendiest hairstylist in the garden, known for its ability to create cool hairstyles on hard nut shells. Although the lifespan of this hairstyle is short, it doesn't stop people from loving it—and the opening of the sixth nut hair salon chain.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Umbrella Shell has the traits of both his fusion ingredients.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Has the characteristics of Umbrella Leaf and Wall-nut. Can repel approaching zombies, dealing 40 Dano every time.</color>

plants.name: Bombrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Bombrella has changed to a new hairstyle, making it look even more rebellious and irritable, like a delinquent wandering the streets. But don't be fooled by its appearance; it actually has a soft heart and even helps the barber clean up the fallen leaves.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>When repelling, it causes small-scale cherry explosions, and harnesses the power of cherry explosions to protect surrounding plants.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>600</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Umbrella Leaf.
<color=black>•</color> Repel approaching zombies and release a small-Alcance cherry explosion with a Dano of 360. 
<color=black>•</color> Immune to explosive basketballs.
<color=black>•</color> For every instance of Cherry-fused defensive plants healing in the surrounding 3×3 area, it gains 1 level of energy, up to 100 level. 
<color=black>•</color> Bombrella uses 2 levels to absorb any Dano in the surrounding 3×3 area.</color>

plants.name: Chrono Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Nothing has been born earlier than the universe, and nothing will perish slower than the universe. But for life, his/her body is not as enduring as the death of a star; his/her spirit is even more eternal than the universe. Cherish the present, seize the future, even if it's just for a day or two, that is still a mayfly's life." — "Chronicles"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Peashooter with the power to warp space and time, firing neutron peas that inflict the chronoshift effect, erasing every trace of the target from the time continuum.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks deal no Dano but apply chronoshift for 1.5 seconds, or extend the duration by 1 second if the target is already affected. Deals only 100 Dano to Mini-bosses.</color>
<color=#00008B>Chronoshift: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies under this effect receive a countdown of (HP / 36) seconds, after which they are instantly erased. If the effect ends early, they take 36 × (elapsed second) points worth of Dano.</color>

plants.name: Kernel Lure
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The elderly also need to learn to keep up with the times," the Kernel Lure said, "This new force of magnetism has truly opened my eyes." Of course, there is a small problem; it always makes the neighbors think I'm a scrap collector.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Kernel Lure can fuse with metal objects and changes into the corresponding form based on the type.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 25% chance to throw a magnetic butter with 80 Dano, and stuns the target for 4 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Chrono Kernel
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You've seen Interstellar, right?" Chrono Kernel often brings up his favorite sci-fi movie. "The male protagonist drives into a cornfield at the beginning and then pilots a spaceship into a black hole at the end. There must be some connection between the two!" Chrono Kernel insists.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chrono Kernel has a chance to throw a neutron butter that generates a mini black hole.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal Plant. Has a 25% chance to throw a neutron butter with 100 Dano, which generates a mini black hole when it hits. The mini black hole massively slows zombies down and explodes after 2 seconds, causing 100 Dano and reducing the countdown of zombies with the chronoshift effect by 36 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Rust-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Rust-pult has been considering buying some anti-rust paint lately, as his butter always ends up with a bit of a rusty taste, which seriously hinders his ability to make butter cakes for his brothers. "Butter with a rusty taste might only be good for fighting zombies."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Rust-pult throws Iron kernels or Iron butter that is miraculously effective against Type 1 armor.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Has a 25% chance to throw an Iron butter with 100 Dano, which stuns the target for 4 seconds and removes their Type 1 armor instantly.</color>

plants.name: Frozen Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants all say that Frozen Cherry is calm, introverted, and taciturn. "I occasionally confide in the other cherries," Frozen Cherry said, "they call it 'explosive news.'"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherry mold made of ice, he absorbs cherry projectiles from plants to generate Cherry Bomb seedpackets.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Absorbing cherries, ignited cherries, and explosive cherries grants 1, 2, and 10 energy points respectively. For every 100 energy points collected, a Cherry Bomb seed packet is generated. Upon death, unleashes a Cherry Bomb explosion and freezes all zombies in its Alcance for 10 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Dormant-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Using magnetism to confine nuclear energy is a topic that Dormant-shroom has been researching for a long time. This is a difficult task, and timing is crucial; numerous laboratories of his are now in ruins. However, it seems that the zombies are more eager for him to succeed than the plants.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dormant-shroom is stabilized by magnetic force and can be fused with metal to transform into a corresponding form.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not explode until further fusion.</color>

plants.name: ChronoDoom-gumelo
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Time travel personnel have passed through, complete. The time tunnel has exited the target world, complete. Observed impact is within the expected Alcance, complete. Proceed to the next step, destroy the tunnel to prevent use by others or organizations." — "Time Planning Bureau"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>ChronoDoom-gumelo possesses the power of hyperspace bending. Its explosion inflicts chronoshift to any foe unfortunate enough to be caught in its effects.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremação) </color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Doom-gumelo. Explosion reduces the countdown of zombies with the chronoshift effect by 36 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Chrono-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Other plants often hear Chrono-nut recount the mysteries on his adventures — like a Sphinx with a zombie’s head, a minivan that only beeps, and the 1001 kinds of machines developed by GFishtus Corps.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Wall-nut with spacetime powers. He has a chance to teleport back attackers and can rewind health once when near death.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Chance to teleport biters to the far right of the same row (10-second cooldown)
<color=black>•</color> When taking lethal Dano, rewinds HP to what it was 3 seconds ago and becomes invulnerable for 3 seconds (single use ability)</color>

plants.name: Pea Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pea Drone sees himself as the future of garden warfare. "Support-type aerial drones — a weapon of a new era." Unfortunately, he has little time to promote his ideas — he works three jobs to pay off his soilless cultivation loan.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A peashooter drone that enhances firepower when coordinating with straight-shooting plants below.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. If the shooter directly beneath it attacks faster than once every 1.5 seconds, Pea Drone syncs its attack rate to match.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Sawshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>In the snowy plains, it’s said that the taller the Christmas tree, the happier the next year will be. So who can place the star on top? That's a job for the Spruce Sawshooter and his unmatched aim.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing saws that leave spinning spruce needles on zombies.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3 Seconds; 1×75/1.5 Seconds (Spinning spruce needle)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles pierce once (including ice blocks) and leave spinning pine needles on the first zombie hit.
<color=black>•</color> Spinning needles deal 1 Dano every 0.02 seconds for 1.5 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Soak-me-not
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After equipping a high-pressure water jet, Soak-me-not greatly improved her cutting efficiency. But there's one downside — flowing water is hard to come by on the snowy plains.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold-resistant, deals more Dano compared to Não-me-cortes and applies Frio when there are ice charges.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>8/0.02s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charge when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> With ice charges, attacks deal double Dano, inflict Deep Frio and add 1 Cryo Point, but have an 1/15 chance to use up a charge. </color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Sprayshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Can an archer compete without a bow? Droplet Shooter shrugs: "It's just waterbending."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Bends and shoots water orbs; consumes ice charges to launch ice blocks instead.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>50/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Uses 1 ice charge to shoot an ice block with double the Dano that inflicts Deep Frio and adds 40 Cryo points, dealing ×4 Dano to Frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Supershooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spruce Supershooter is stern, cold, and strict—perfect traits for a top-tier coach.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots spinning hydro-needles that cling to zombies. Consumes ice charges to shoot spinning cryo-needles instead.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>5×75/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Spinning hydro-needles deal 5 Dano per 0.02 seconds and last 1.5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Uses 1 ice charge to shoot spinning cryo-needles with double the Dano that inflict Deep Frio and adds 1 Cryo points, dealing ×4 Dano to Frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Snowbloom Spruce
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"People talk about iron trees blooming or old trees flowering," Snowbloom Spruce murmurs. "But I’m neither iron nor old. I just... never mind." He stops talking to admire his blossoms.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spruce with Lótus de Neve blooms and a reduced cost for healing nearby plants.

<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 ice charge passively every 10 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/blizzard respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Awakens at 5 charges, firing an ice orb that deals 100 Dano with 3×3 splash (no falloff) and inflicts Deep Frio.
<color=black>•</color> While awake, consumes 1 charge per sec to heal a 3×3 area by 50 HP. Returns to sleep when charge is exhausted.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Shield Lotus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Her bunny ears are so cute!" "She’s adorable even when asleep!" "Like a rose!" Shield Lotus sleepily swats away the fans that lack a sense of personal space—yes, she's thorny like a rose, but that hasn’t stopped the admiration.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A steel-leaved Lotus that heals nearby plants and gives them shields.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits Lótus de Neve traits. Healing also grants 50 points of Shield to each plant. See Não-me-cortes for Mecânica do Escudo explanation.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Firnalha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spruce Firnalha always carries dry spruce leaves. He claims they're excellent "green" fuel—flammable and easy to collect. Right now, he's sun-drying a batch.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnalha that absorbed Spruce Sharpshooter, with an expanded protection Alcance.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnalha but with Alcance expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnalha after 210 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Saw Firnalha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Using potassium as fuel not only provides ample heat, but also gives off beautiful flame colors," Saw Firnalha enthusiastically explains. "And this fan, modified from a circular saw, helps blow hot air right to you." As a top employee of the snowfield sauna, he's always committed to providing the best service.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnalha that absorbed Não-me-cortes, with an expanded protection Alcance.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnalha but with Alcance expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnalha after 120 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Lotus Firnalha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I was born extraordinary," claims Lotus Firnalha. He thinks he glows from phosphorus fire — but actually, it’s just fireflies hiding from the cold inside him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnalha that absorbed Lótus de Neve, with an expanded protection Alcance.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnalha but with Alcance expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnalha after 60 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Aloe Firnalha
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Aloe Firnalha has upgraded its air system to better regulate temperature in small areas. The only problem: the water dripping from the condenser tends to freeze quickly in the snowfield.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnalha that absorbed Aloe Aqua, with an expanded protection Alcance.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnalha but with Alcance expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnalha after 90 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Aloe Alba
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doctor Aloe Alba is the most beloved young doctor in the hospital. It's not just due to his diligence and skill — it might also be his mustache-like leaves. After all, patients tend to trust older-looking doctors.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws aloe extract upwards; upon falling, it heals surrounding plants and temporarily boosts their attack speed.

<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 ice charge passively every 5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom/blizzard respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Every 5 seconds, consumes 5 charges to heal all plants in a 3×3 area for 50 HP and boost their attack speed by 36% for 5 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>
plants.cost:
<size=36>
Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Aloe Aqua + Lótus de Neve</color>

plants.name: Icy Esmaga
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>To tame its hot temper, Icy Esmaga locked itself in the freezer for three days and nights. Now it keeps the mood ice-cold — so cold that the other plants don't dare say a word to 'set it off.' As for zombies… let's just say, no one's allowed to 'break the ice' with it.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Esmaga imbued with freezing power.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon landing deals 600 Dano to zombies in a 3×3 area and freezes them for 4s.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Esmaga
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've finally realized zombies really are our friends,"said Hypno Esmaga, who quickly joined the Zombie Buddy Club. The only problem: his extremely radical way of showing friendship turned all the other members into conservative ones.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Esmaga that overwhelms zombies with charm.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypnotizes the zombies he crushes, deals 1800 Dano instead if the zombie cannot be hypnotized.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Alho
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Alho doesn't quite fit in with the rest of the Alho family — he's far too popular for that. Loved and envied by his kin, he pays them no mind. All he wants is to pull his hat low over his eyes and enjoy a peaceful nap whenever he can.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Alho with a shroomy hypno-cap mushroom on its head.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> Causes hypnotized zombies that touch him to switch lanes.
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker, forces it to switch lanes, then reverts to regular Alho.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Mine isn't one for rushing. It believes every zombie deserves a second chance — preferably before it explodes. Contradictory? Maybe. But it's perfectly in line with its five personal principles, which it refuses to share.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mine with an explosive charm.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> Hypnotizes the zombies exploded, deals 1800 Dano instead if the zombie cannot be hypnotized.</color>

plants.name: Tangle Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Originally a naval mine tossed ashore by a powerful tsunami, this fella now lies half-buried in the soil. Though the kelp outside has withered, the explosives inside remain deadly.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mine tangled with kelp.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> When armed, insta-kills the first approaching zombie and triggers a Potato Mine explosion.</color>

plants.name: Kelp Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Beware, ships — reefs ahead!" Tangle Mine serves as the river's safety officer, signaling danger with a red light. He does a solid job, since wherever he appears, danger is never far behind.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Emaranhalga that's as explosive as Potato Mine.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> Insta-kills the first approaching zombie and deals 600 Dano to zombies in a 3×3 area.</color>

plants.name: Firnurse
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Firnurse brings warmth and life to the frozen wilderness. Despite his odd appearance, the local kids adore him. "Sugar cube, anyone?" he offers cheerfully. "Helps keep the heat in!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Stable high-temp Firnalha that periodically provides charges or healing to nearby plants.

<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits of Firnalha, with a 3×3 protection Alcance.
<color=black>•</color> Provides 1 ice charge to protected Snow plants every 3s.
<color=black>•</color> Heals protected plants for 50 HP every 15s.</color>

plants.name: Scorch Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Always wear a smile"—that’s rule number one for Scorch Wall-nut, the ever-patient restaurant server. Even when half-melted Frost Wall-nut is slipping all over the floor yelling about the lack of a 'Wet Floor' sign, he just keeps smiling. And sizzling.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy-flavored nut that scorches biters.

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals 20 Dano to biters and inflicts Enflamed debuff.</color>

plants.name: Doom-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom-nut is a huge fan of Batman. He rarely speaks, preferring to lurk in shadows and only shows up at the occasional Comic-cons. One time, he startled McCornics in a hallway. "When did Doom-gumelo get... this bulky?" the old corn muttered.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nut with nuclear potential. 

<color=black>Resistência: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to non-physical explosions. 
<color=black>•</color> Prevents Doom-gumelo Zombies in a 3×3 area from exploding. 
<color=black>•</color> Heals for 100 HP when a zombie with Ember debuff dies nearby.
<color=black>•</color> Triggers Doom-gumelo effect on death.</color>

plants.name: Spike-kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spike-Kelp always felt like the runt of the Erva-espinho family—small, unnoticeable, and half-submerged. The others tried to cheer him up: "Hey, at least you're still more popular than that prickly old Spike-nut."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Erva-espinho but aquatic and tangly.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks add 1 Tangle Value. Takes 10 Dano every time he attacks a vehicle.</color>

plants.name: Tangle Weed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Founder of the now-famous aquatic foot massage empire, Tangle Weed has redefined spa therapy. With branches in every biome and a new line of vehicular massage lanes, business is booming—Especially with traffic this bad.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Erva-espinho that tangles zombies even on land.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks add 1 land Tangle Value (1/3 the efficacy of aquatic Tangle Value).</color>

plants.name: SideroDoom-gumelo
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Boom! A reality-defying burst of high-speed nuclear fission tears zombies apart, breaking down their atoms and rearranging them into the most stable form known to plantkind: iron. "Why iron buckets?" SideroDoom-gumelo pauses, then replies, "Because I was born that way."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Powerful Doom-gumelo that turns the ashes from his explosion into Buckets.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>3640 (Cremação)</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Every zombie he kills drops a Bucket.</color>

plants.name: Potato-spreader
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Potato-spreader loves playing tricks underground. It shoots out surprises not once, not twice, but thrice—like a cheeky prankster with a never-ending stash of boom. Watch your step, or you might get a triple whammy that’ll blow your boots off.

- Written by Mrs. Draco</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato-spreader resurfaces after exploding and fires potatoes across three lanes.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>36×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Planta baixa (evade projéteis diretos).
<color=black>•</color> Attacks faster as zombies get closer (down to 0.5s per attack).
<color=black>•</color> When armed, explodes on contact, dealing 5400 Dano and knocks back surviving for 1 tile.
<color=black>•</color>Re-emerges 15 seconds after exploding. Explodes and disappears immediately upon contact with vehicles.</color>

plants.name: Lumos Angler
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>They say Lumos Angler has never gone hungry—not once. Every chomp lands a juicy zombie. He even published a book sharing his secrets: "Wiggle... wiggle... zombies love a gentle glow." — From his work Lantern.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lures in zombies to snack on with his lophos.

<color=black>Dano: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Each Lumos level reduces digest time by 10s to a minimum of 10s.</color>
<color=black>Especial: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon successful digestion, pulls a nearby zombie from adjacent lanes to its lane.</color>
